randomSoldiers.description:
Determines number and type of starting X-Com soldiers.

If a mod contains more than one type of soldiers, this can also be specified with:

```
 randomSoldiers:
   STR_SOLDIER: 3
   STR_ANOTHER_SOLDIER: 7

```

facilities.description: List of starting base facilities and their position (x and y coordinates being 0-5).

items.description: List of starting items in the base, excluding items on crafts.

crafts.description: List of starting crafts in the base and items on board.

lon.description: Longitude of the base location, in radians.

lat.description: Latitude of the base location, in radians.

soldiers.description: List of starting base soldiers, their names, stats and everything else.

transfers.description: List of items, soldiers, engineers and/or scientists inbound to the starting base with a specified time lag.

research.description: List of ongoing research projects in the starting base.

productions.description: List of ongoing manufacturing projects in the starting base.

retaliationTarget.description: Flag saying whether the aliens know about your starting base or not.

data.description: Path to a file, which contains polygon and texture information. (For example WORLD.DAT).

polygons.description:
List of polygons drawn on the globe surface. A triangle consist of seven values: the first number defines the texture, followed by three pairs of (x,y) globe coordinates. Only polygons with 3 or 4 vertices are reliably shown on the globe, i.e. 7 or 9 values per entry.

Note that:

*   **data** and **polygons** define the same thing... use one or another, not both
*   each time you define data or polygons, their previous definition is completely deleted (i.e. globe can be defined only as a whole, not incrementally)

polylines.description:
List of border lines. Each list entry consist of a list of (x,y) globe coordinates.

Note that:

*   each time you define polylines, their previous definition is completely deleted (i.e. they can be defined only as a whole, not incrementally)

textures.description: List of globe textures that determine the battlescape appearance of a certain place on the globe.

baseColor.description: Color of the xcom base labels (0-255).

oceanPalette.description: Color range (defined as palette offset) of the "oceans", or better said of the "globe sections not covered by polygons" (0-15).

oceanShading.description:
Whether ocean shading (32-color) should be used or not.

Notes:

*   normally land uses 16-color shading and ocean uses 32-color shading... where "ocean" is defined as "lack of texture", i.e. for UFO lack of land and for TFTD lack of water
*   for hybrids (i.e. mods that combine UFO and TFTD textures together), there is no "ocean" anymore, because the globe is fully covered by textures (land and water textures)
*   thus the original 32 colors used for ocean shading can be:
    *   re-used to provide more colors for the textures (2 distinct color ranges, 16 colors each)
    *   ignored for ocean shading purposes, and used for texture shading purposes instead

id.description:
ID of the texture.

*   Terrain-based textures have positive IDs (0, 1, 2, ...) and are used for drawing globe polygons
*   AlienDeployment-based textures have negative IDs (-1, -2, -3, ...) and are **not** used for drawing globe polygons

terrain.description:
List of terrains (can be more than one) that correspond to each [Geoscape texture](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/TEXTURE.DAT).

Terrains can be restricted to certain areas on the globe with **area: (_\[lon1, lon2, lat1, lat2\]_)** and **weight: NUMBER** that gives their chance of appearance.

These textures are primarily used for UFO landing/crash sites.

Example 1:

```
globe:
  textures:
    - id: 0
      terrain:
        - name: FOREST
          area: [0, 360, -90, 0]
        - name: JUNGLE
          area: [0, 360, 0, 90]

```

Example 2:

```
globe:
  textures:
    - id: 11
      terrain:
        - name: PIPES
          weight: 50
        - name: SEABED
          weight: 25
        - name: CORAL
          weight: 25

```

deployments.description:
Defined by weighted alien deployments (can be more than one), which determine appearance for mission sites (e.g. terror sites, artifact sites, shipping lanes, etc.).

Example:

```
globe:
  textures:
    - id: -4
      deployments:
        STR_CARGO_SHIP_P1: 50
        STR_CRUISE_SHIP_P1: 50

```

baseTerrain.description:
In OXCE, the terrain-based textures can additionally have separate terrain defined for base defense missions.

This terrain can be used in map scripting to replace the generic "dirt" blocks with something more fitting (e.g. snow in the arctic or jungle near the equator).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,5108.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,5108.0.html)

startingCondition.description: In OXCE, the textures can have their own starting conditions (with lower priority than deployment starting conditions).

fakeUnderwater.description:
In OXCE, the (land) textures can also be flagged as fake underwater textures using this boolean attribute.

Such terrain can support underwater missions, underwater bases/facilities and have separate starting conditions.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,11063.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,11063.0.html)

type.description: String ID of the country name.

signedPactEvent.description: String ID of the event triggered when the country leaves Xcom project.

rejoinedXcomEvent.description: String ID of the event triggered when the country rejoins Xcom project.

fundingBase.description: Country's base funding, in thousands. The starting funding can be anywhere between 1x and 2x the base funding.

fundingCap.description: Country's funding cap, in thousands. Once a country reaches this maximum, it will no longer increase its funding.

labelLon\nlabelLat.description: Longitude and latitude coordinates of the country's label on the globe. This label is only shown when the globe is zoomed in and "detail" is turned on.

areas.description: List of "rectangles" on the globe defined as \[_lon1_ _lon2_ _lat1_ _lat2_\]. Any activity within these areas counts towards the country's graph activity and affects their opinion of the player.

zoomLevel.description:
Minimum globe zoom level at which this extra globe label becomes visible.

Note: doesn't work for countries. Only for extra globe labels.

type.description: String ID of the region name.

cost.description: Amount of money spent building an X-COM base in this region (first base is free).

areas.description:
List of "rectangles" on the globe defined as _\[lon1, lon2, lat1, lat2\]_. Any activity within these areas counts towards the region's graph activity.

Example:

```
 regions:
   - type: STR_EUROPE
     areas:
       - [335, 60, -70, -35]

```

deleteOldAreas.description: Can be used in mods to delete areas defined by a parent mod.

regionWeight.description: Weight of this region when selecting regions for alien missions.

missionWeights.description: Weighted list of the different mission types for this region (eg. _STR\_ALIEN\_RESEARCH: 14_).

missionZones.description:
List of mission zones. Mission zones are used for generating waypoints for UFO trajectories, and also for spawning mission sites and alien bases. Each mission zone itself is a list of "mission areas", where each mission area is defined by:

*   a "rectangle" (_\[lon1, lon2, lat1, lat2\]_) defining a relevant section of the globe (does not need to be within the region itself); or a single point (a city) on the globe

Zones used for mission site spawning additionally have:

*   a texture ID (from globe ruleset, this should be the alienDeployment-based texture, usually the ID is a negative number)
*   and optionally a city string ID (will be displayed on the globe if defined)

Example: (_\[lon1, lon2, lat1, lat2, textureID, STR\_CITY\_NAME\]_).

**Important:** Crossing the prime meridian in **missionZones** requires a different syntax! (_lon2_ cannot be smaller than _lon1_)

Wrong example:

```
 [350,   8, 20, 30]

```

Correct example:

```
 [350, 368, 20, 30]  # 368 (=8+360) also represents 8 degrees, and satisfies the _lon2 >= lon1_ condition

```

PS: This syntax exception does not apply to **areas**.

missionRegion.description: Spawn mission in this region instead (used for regions without land).

type.description: String ID of the facility name.

fakeUnderwater.description:
Defines whether the facility can be built in a standard base, fake underwater base (used by hybrid mods), or both.

Possible options:

*   \-1 = both (default)
*   0 = only standard base
*   1 = only fake underwater base

requires.description: List of [topics](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Research) (string IDs) that must be researched to unlock this facility. If none are specified, this facility is unlocked from the start.

requiresBaseFunc.description: A list of services required to build this facility.

provideBaseFunc.description: A list of services this facility provides after being built.

forbiddenBaseFunc.description: A list of services that cannot be used anymore after this facility is built.

spriteShape.description: Sprite ID from [BASEBITS.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/BASEBITS.PCK) used to draw the facility's outer shape in the Basescape and UFOpaedia.

spriteFacility.description: Sprite ID from [BASEBITS.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/BASEBITS.PCK) used to draw the facility's contents in the Basescape and UFOpaedia. Drawn on top of **spriteShape**. Not required for buildings size 2 or larger.

connectorsDisabled.description: Should the game draw facility connectors leading from/to this facility in the base view?

missileAttraction.description: A weight (i.e. not a percentage) of how likely will alien missiles/bombardments hit this type of facility.

destroyedFacility.description:
String ID of the destroyed version of this facility (must have the same size).

Note: destruction can happen either in Base Defense mission or via Alien missiles/bombardment.

lift.description: Is this facility an [Access Lift](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Access_Lift)? All base facilities must be connected to the lift.

hyper.description: Is this facility a [Hyperwave Decoder](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Hyperwave_Decoder)? Displays extra information for detected UFOs. Only valid for radar facilities. If "true", the radar detection chance will be taken from **radarChance** value.

mind.description: Is this facility a [Mind Shield](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Mind_Shield)? Reduces the chance of UFOs finding your base. Does stack (detection chance is inversely proportional to the number of mind shields).

mindPower.description: The power of the mind shield provided by this facility.

grav.description: Is this facility a [Grav Shield](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Grav_Shield)? Each shield allows for an extra defense round in which all of your base defenses can fire again.

size.description: Size of the facility, in grid units. Every facility is square, so a size of 1 means 1x1, 2 means 2x2, etc. Bigger facilities are made up of multiple sprites, for example a 2x2 facility will use 4 sprites for **spriteShape** and 4 sprites for **spriteFacility** (top-left, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-right).

buildCost.description: Amount of money spent to build this facility in the base.

refundValue.description: Amount of money refunded when the facility is dismantled.

buildCostItems.description:
Items needed to build a facility and items "refunded" when the facility is dismantled.```
 - type: STR_MY_FACILITY
   buildCostItems:
     STR_ALIEN_ALLOYS:
       build: 100
       refund: 75
     STR_ALIEN_ENTERTAINMENT:
       build: 1
       refund: 1

```

buildTime.description: Amount of days it takes for this facility to be built.

monthlyCost.description: Amount of money spent monthly for the maintenance of this facility.

storage.description: Amount of storage space (for items) this facility provides. See [Base Stores](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Base_Stores).

storageTiles.description: A list of tile positions where to place items in this facility's storage. If empty, vanilla checkerboard pattern will be used.

personnel.description: Amount of personnel (soldiers, scientsts, engineers) these quarters can contain.

aliens.description: Amount of live aliens this facility can contain. Only checked if the _storageLimitsEnforced_ option is enabled.

prisonType.description:
What type of prisoners (aliens) can be held in this facility.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4830.msg69933.html#msg69933](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4830.msg69933.html#msg69933)

crafts.description: Amount of X-COM craft this facility can contain.

labs.description: Amount of lab space this facility provides for research projects.

workshops.description: Amount of workshop space this facility provides for manufacture projects.

psiLabs.description: Amount of soldier space this facility provides for psionic training.

trainingRooms.description: Amount of soldier space this facility provides for combat/martial training.

radarRange.description: Maximum radar detection range of this facility, in nautical miles.

radarChance.description: Chance (0-100%) of this radar detecting a UFO that enters its range.

sightRange.description: Range at which the facility can detect alien bases in nautical miles.

sightChance.description: Chance (0-100%) of this facility detecting an alien base that enters its sight range. More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8119.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8119.0.html)

defense.description: Offensive power provided by this base defense against attacking UFOs.

hitRatio.description: Chance (0-100) of the base defense hitting an attacking UFO.

ammoItem.description: Specifies the ammo item needed for this facility during base defense. More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7651.msg133495.html#msg133495](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7651.msg133495.html#msg133495)

ammoNeeded.description: Specifies the amount of ammo spent when firing once.

fireSound.description: Sound ID from [GEO.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when the base defense fires.

hitSound.description: Sound ID from [GEO.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when the base defense hits a target.

placeSound.description: Sound ID from [GEO.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when the facility is placed (or when the facility remains after dismantling another facility).

mapName.description: [Map](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/MAPS) associated to this facility in Battlescape base defenses.

verticalLevels.description:
Can be used instead of **mapName**. Allows generating a base facility map as if it were an _addBlock_ map script command.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,5316.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,5316.0.html)

maxAllowedPerBase.description: Maximum number of facilities of this type allowed to be built per base.

manaRecoveryPerDay.description: How much mana does the facility recover per day. The facility setting is NOT cumulative, more facilities don't provide more regen. If there are multiple facilities of different type with different regen rate, the best (highest) regen rate is used.

healthRecoveryPerDay.description:
How much health/HP does the facility recover per day. The facility setting is NOT cumulative, more facilities don't provide more regen. If there are multiple facilities of different type with different regen rate, the best (highest) regen rate is used.

FIXME: add a link to more detailed description of this feature!

sickBayAbsoluteBonus.description:
How much additional HP is healed per day.```
 - type: STR_FIELD_HOSPITAL
   sickBayAbsoluteBonus: 0.75
   sickBayRelativeBonus: 0.0
 - type: STR_SURGERY_ROOM
   sickBayAbsoluteBonus: 0.25
   sickBayRelativeBonus: 1.0
 - type: STR_REGENERATION_ROOM
   sickBayAbsoluteBonus: 0.0
   sickBayRelativeBonus: 10.0
 - type: STR_GOAULD_SARCOPHAGUS
   sickBayAbsoluteBonus: 90.0
   sickBayRelativeBonus: 0.0

```

Examples, considering the ruleset above:

*   with no facilities: 1 hp healed per day
*   with one field hospital: 1.75 hp per day
*   with one surgery room: 1.25 hp per day + 1% of soldier's max hp
*   with 2 field hospitals and 2 surgery rooms: 3 hp per day + 2% of soldier's max hp
*   with regeneration room: 10% of soldier's max hp... i.e. fully recovered in 10 days or less
*   with Goa'uld sarcophagus: 90 hp per day... i.e. fully healed overnight

sickBayRelativeBonus.description:
How much additional HP is healed per day.```
 - type: STR_FIELD_HOSPITAL
   sickBayAbsoluteBonus: 0.75
   sickBayRelativeBonus: 0.0
 - type: STR_SURGERY_ROOM
   sickBayAbsoluteBonus: 0.25
   sickBayRelativeBonus: 1.0
 - type: STR_REGENERATION_ROOM
   sickBayAbsoluteBonus: 0.0
   sickBayRelativeBonus: 10.0
 - type: STR_GOAULD_SARCOPHAGUS
   sickBayAbsoluteBonus: 90.0
   sickBayRelativeBonus: 0.0

```

Examples, considering the ruleset above:

*   with no facilities: 1 hp healed per day
*   with one field hospital: 1.75 hp per day
*   with one surgery room: 1.25 hp per day + 1% of soldier's max hp
*   with 2 field hospitals and 2 surgery rooms: 3 hp per day + 2% of soldier's max hp
*   with regeneration room: 10% of soldier's max hp... i.e. fully recovered in 10 days or less
*   with Goa'uld sarcophagus: 90 hp per day... i.e. fully healed overnight

leavesBehindOnSell.description: A facility to leave behind a dismantled facility (must be of the same size); or a list of 1x1 facilities to fill in the old facility's place.

removalTime.description:
How long facilities left behind when this one is sold should take to build.

Possible options:

*   \-1 = take **buildTime** from the other facilities' rulesets
*   0 = instant
*   1+ = that many days

Note: doesn't do anything without **leavesBehindOnSell**

canBeBuiltOver.description: Can this facility be built over?

buildOverFacilities.description: A list of other base facilities this one can be built over. If empty, it can be built over anything with _canBeBuiltOver: true_.

rightClickActionType.description:
Which screen should open when R-clicking on this facility in the base view?

Possible options:

*   0 = OpenXcom default
*   1 = Prison (Alien Containment)
*   2 = Manufacturing
*   3 = Research
*   4 = Martial Training
*   5 = Psi Training
*   6 = Barracks
*   7 = Market (Sell)
*   other = go to Geoscape

type.description: String ID of the craft name.

selectSound.description:
Sound ID from [GEO.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when a craft is selected on the globe. Can be a list with multiple options.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10195.msg143053.html#msg143053](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10195.msg143053.html#msg143053)

takeoffSound.description: Sound ID from [GEO.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when a craft is taking off from a base. Can be a list with multiple options.

requires.description: List of [topics](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Research) (string IDs) that must be researched to unlock this craft. If none are specified, this craft is unlocked from the start.

requiresBuyBaseFunc.description: A list of services required to buy this craft.

requiresBuyCountry.description: An allied country required to be able to buy this craft.

sprite.description:
Sprite ID from [BASEBITS.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/BASEBITS.PCK) used to draw this craft in the Basescape and from [INTICON.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/INTICON.PCK) used to draw the damage indicator in dogfights.

Note that:

*   the corresponding id for INTICON.PCK for the minimized craft icon is sprite+0
*   the corresponding id for INTICON.PCK for the dogfight image is sprite+11
*   the corresponding id for BASEBITS.PCK is sprite+33

maxSkinIndex.description: A maximum number of skins supported by this craft. Zero-based. I.e. a craft with 4 possible skins should set this attribute to 3.

skinSprites.description: A list of additional **sprite**s used for alternate craft skins.

marker.description:
Sprite ID from GlobeMarkers spritesheet, used for drawing craft icon on the globe. Usually 3x3 pixels, but can be modded to be bigger.

Note: if not modded, sprite id 1 is used (=vanilla craft marker)

weapons.description:
Amount of craft weapons this craft can equip. The UI can only display a max of 2 weapons.

In OXCE, you can have up to **4 weapons** (or other accessories)

weaponTypes.description:
A list defining compatible weapon types for this craft type. Up to 4 slots, and each slot can have up to 4 compatible weapon types.

Example: \[0, \[0, 1\], \[2,3\], \[0,2,4\]\]

weaponStrings.description: A list describing the craft's weapon slots (up to 4 slots).

fixedWeapons.description: A list with fixed built-in craft weapons (up to 4 slots). More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9047.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9047.0.html)

soldiers.description: Amount of units (soldiers and vehicles) this craft can carry.

pilots.description:
How many pilots are required to pilot this craft.

Notes:

*   pilots are also soldiers and will be fighting in the Battlescape
*   pilots give bonuses/penalties to the craft performance in the Dogfights (based on their skills)
*   pilots gain experience via Dogfights
*   you can manually assign pilots to the craft; if you don't want to, they can be assigned automatically

allowLanding.description:
Should this craft be able to start a Battlescape mission?

Note: you may want to set _false_ to your manned/piloted interceptors.

vehicles.description:
Amount of vehicles this craft can carry.

Note: in OXCE, it's the amount of vehicles **and** 2x2 soldiers. In OXCE, it can also have a value of -1, which means unlimited.

maxSmallSoldiers.description: Maximum amount of 1x1 soldiers this craft can carry. (-1 = unlimited)

maxLargeSoldiers.description: Maximum amount of 2x2 soldiers this craft can carry. (-1 = unlimited)

maxSmallVehicles.description: Maximum amount of 1x1 vehicles this craft can carry. (-1 = unlimited)

maxLargeVehicles.description: Maximum amount of 2x2 vehicles this craft can carry. (-1 = unlimited)

maxSmallUnits.description: Maximum amount of 1x1 soldiers and 1x1 vehicles this craft can carry. (-1 = unlimited)

maxLargeUnits.description: Maximum amount of 2x2 soldiers and 2x2 vehicles this craft can carry. (-1 = unlimited)

maxSoldiers.description: Maximum amount of 1x1 soldiers and 2x2 soldiers this craft can carry. (-1 = unlimited)

maxVehicles.description: Maximum amount of 1x1 vehicles and 2x2 vehicles this craft can carry. (-1 = unlimited)

costBuy.description: Amount of money spent for purchasing this craft. If set to 0, the craft will not be available in the Purchase/Recruit screen.

monthlyBuyLimit.description: How many craft of this type you can purchase per month. 0 = infinite.

costRent.description: Amount of money spent monthly for renting this craft. If set to 0, the craft is not on rental and won't count towards base maintenance.

costSell.description: Amount of money gained for selling this craft.

forceShowInMonthlyCosts.description:
Forces this craft type to appear in Monthly Costs breakdown, even if not present at the base.

Note: Skyranger, Interceptor, Triton and Barracuda have this turned on (for backwards-compatibility).

refuelItem.description: Item required for refueling this craft. If no item is specified, the craft uses human fuel.

repairRate.description: Amount of damage restored every hour while [Repairing](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Repairs) in base.

refuelRate.description: Amount of fuel restored every 30 mins while [Refueling](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Refueling) in base. If specified, a **refuelItem** is spent each time.

transferTime.description: Number of hours it takes to purchase/transfer this craft to a base.

score.description: [Score](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Score) lost when this craft is destroyed.

battlescapeTerrainData.description: [Terrain](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Terrains) associated to this craft in Battlescape missions.

craftInventoryTile.description:
Coordinates \[x, y, z\] of the craft inventory tile (weapon's pile) in the craft. If not specified, tile occupied by the first soldier is used.

Note: You can change this attribute only if your mod also contains the **battlescapeTerrainData** attribute. Since OXCE 7.4.4 this limitation doesn't apply.

Note: Since OXCE 7.4.6 this attribute can be used also on craft that don't use **deployment**, for example STR\_SKYRANGER.

mapVisible.description: Should the craft map be visible at the beginning of the battle? Used for some funky effects (see W40k mod for examples).

deployment.description:
Custom positions for the unit deployment in the craft, listed as: _\[x, y, z, facing\]_

If not specified, units are placed on empty spots from top-left to bottom-right facing top-right.

useAllStartTiles.description:
Should the craft preview features use all spawnable/start tiles or only the ones specified by the **deployment** ?

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10370.msg144057.html#msg144057](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10370.msg144057.html#msg144057)

customPreview.description: String ID of an alien deployment that should be used for craft preview (overrides the default alien deployment STR\_CRAFT\_DEPLOYMENT\_PREVIEW).

keepCraftAfterFailedMission.description: Defines whether the craft should be lost after a failed mission or not. Useful for example to implement paratroopers; or any kind of troop deployment without a craft physically being on the map.

notifyWhenRefueled.description: Should a pop up window inform the player once this craft is fully refueled?

undetectable.description: Can this craft be detected by alien bases and alien hunter-killers? Primarily meant for stationary radar craft or satellites.

autoPatrol.description: Should this craft automatically return to its patrol destination after refueling?

maxAltitude.description: Maximum altitude (0-4) this craft can dogfight to.

maxItems.description: Amount of items this craft can carry.

maxStorageSpace.description: Total size of items/equipment this craft can carry. Does not include HWP, HWP ammo and armor worn by soldiers.

shieldRechargedAtBase.description: How many shield points are recharged when landed at base per hour.

fuelMax.description: Maximum amount of fuel this craft can carry. Crafts use up fuel based on their speed while traveling.

damageMax.description: Maximum amount of damage this craft can take. If this amount is exceeded, the craft is destroyed.

speedMax.description: Maximum speed in nautical miles. Crafts travel at max speed when flying and half speed when patrolling.

accel.description: Acceleration value shown in the UFOpaedia.

radarRange.description: Detection range of the craft's radar in nautical miles. Every craft radar has a detection chance dependent on its **radarChance**.

radarChance.description: Chance (0-100%) of this craft radar detecting a UFO that enters its range.

sightRange.description: Range at which the craft can detect alien bases in nautical miles.

hitBonus.description: Flat bonus percentage to hit chances of all equipped weapons.

avoidBonus.description: Flat bonus percentage to dodge chances against enemy fire.

powerBonus.description: Multiplier for the power of craft weapons, e.g. 20 = weapons' power increased to 120% of their original power, -20 = decreased to 80%.

armor.description: Amount of blocked damage per hit.

shieldRecharge.description: Defines the percent chance of recharging a point of shielding per game second (GS) during a Dogfight. Values under 100 are the percent chance, for over 100, every +100 means an automatic +1 to shields per GS. Thus _shieldRecharge: 250_ means +2 shields/GS, with a 50% chance of +1 more.

shieldRechargeInGeoscape.description: Similar to **shieldRecharge**, but acts every 5 seconds in the Geoscape. Giving it a value of -1 means instant recharge as soon as 5 seconds pass!

shieldBleedThrough.description: Defines the percent of damage that passes the shield when it goes down. A value of 0 means that with even just 1 shield point, any single hit will be blocked, while 100 means 100% of the damage left after the shield blocks it will go on to damage the craft.

type.description: String ID of the weapon name.

weaponType.description: A weapon's type/category. Used to limit certain weapons/accessories to certain craft weapon slots.

sprite.description:
Sprite ID from [BASEBITS.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/BASEBITS.PCK) used to draw the weapon in the Basescape and from [INTICON.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/INTICON.PCK) used to draw the weapon in dogfights.

Note that:

*   the corresponding id for INTICON.PCK is sprite+5
*   the corresponding id for BASEBITS.PCK is sprite+48

sound.description: Sound ID from [GEO.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this weapon fires.

stats.description:
Contains the same set of attributes as [Craft Stats](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Craft_Stats). These dynamically increase/decrease the stats of a craft, when equipped.

Examples:

*   you can increase the craft's range by equipping an extra fuel tank
*   you can increase the craft's hit chance by equipping advanced targeters
*   you can increase the craft's radar range/chance by equipping an extra radar
*   and so on...

hidePediaInfo.description:
Allows hiding the weapon's stats in the Ufopedia.

Note: this can be used for example when the craft weapon is not really a weapon, but only an equipment/booster (e.g. radar booster, extra fuel tank, etc.).

damage.description: Amount of damage this weapon does to enemy UFOs.

shieldDamageModifier.description: Defines the percent of power that a weapon does to shields.

range.description: Maximum range of this weapon in dogfights (in kilometers).

accuracy.description: Chance (0-100%) of each shot hitting the enemy UFO.

reloadCautious.description: Time this weapon takes to fire between each shot in _Cautious Mode_.

reloadStandard.description: Time this weapon takes to fire between each shot in _Standard Mode_.

reloadAggressive.description: Time this weapon takes to fire between each shot in _Aggressive Mode_.

ammoMax.description: Maximum amount of ammo this weapon can carry.

rearmRate.description: Amount of ammo restored every hour while the craft is [Rearming](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Rearming) in base. If specified, **clip**s are spent depending on their **clipSize**, and **reamRate** should be a multiple of **clipSize**. If the **clipSize** of the specified ammo is 0, no **clip**s are spent.

bulletSaving.description: Should statistical bullet saving apply for this craft weapon?

projectileType.description:
Type of the weapon projectile, used for the projectile sprite in dogfights:

*   0 - [Stingray](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Stingray)
*   1 - [Avalanche](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Avalanche)
*   2 - [Cannon](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Cannon)
*   3 - [Fusion Ball](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Fusion_Ball)
*   4 - [Laser Cannon](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Laser_Cannon)
*   5 - [Plasma Beam](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Plasma_Beam)

projectileSpeed.description: Speed of the weapon projectile in dogfights.

launcher.description: String ID of the [item](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Items) required to equip this weapon.

clip.description: String ID of the [item](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Items) required to rearm this weapon.

underwaterOnly.description: Is this craft weapon restricted to underwater use only?

tractorBeamPower.description:
How much the weapon slows down the maximum speed of a UFO when it's in range and the weapon is active.

Note: Tractor beams allow you to effectively decrease the maximum speed of a UFO during interception, preventing their escape. If you have powerful enough beams targeting the UFO, you can even cause it to land or splash down in the water!

type.description: String ID of the internal item name.

ufopediaType.description:
String ID of alternate ufopedia article for this item (when accessed via middle-button click).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8707.msg154796.html#msg154796](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8707.msg154796.html#msg154796)

name.description: String ID of the displayed item name, for cases where it's different from the internal name. If omitted, **type** is used. Only affects inventory screens and battlescape internals. Does not change the name of items in geoscape lists.

nameAsAmmo.description: Extension for the name of weapons loaded with this item as ammo.

battleType.description:
Defines the weapon's behavior in the Battlescape:

*   0 - None (Geoscape-only item)
*   1 - [Firearm](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Weapons)
*   2 - Ammo
*   3 - Melee
*   4 - [Grenade](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Grenade)
*   5 - [Proximity Grenade](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Proximity_Grenade)
*   6 - [Medi-Kit](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Medi-Kit_(EU))
*   7 - [Motion Scanner](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Motion_Scanner)
*   8 - [Mind Probe](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Mind_Probe)
*   9 - [Psi-Amp](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Psi-Amp)
*   10 - [Electro-flare](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Electro-flare)
*   11 - Corpse

requires.description: List of [topics](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Research) (string IDs) that must be researched to unlock this item. If none are specified, this item is unlocked from the start. Soldiers can only use unlocked items in the Battlescape.

requiresBuy.description:
A list of research topics required to be able to buy this item.

Note: you _can_ use the item even if the requirements are not met... you just can't buy it.

requiresBuyCountry.description: An allied country required to be able to buy this item.

requiresBuyBaseFunc.description: A list of services (for a given base) required to be able to buy this item.

size.description: Space occupied by this item in [Base Stores](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Base_Stores). Can be a decimal value.

costBuy.description: Amount of money spent for purchasing this item. If set to 0, this item will not be available in the Purchase/Recruit screen.

monthlyBuyLimit.description: How many items of this type you can purchase per month. 0 = infinite.

costSell.description: Amount of money gained for selling this item.

transferTime.description: Number of hours it takes to purchase/transfer this item to a base.

categories.description: A list of [categories](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Item_Categories) this item belongs to.

monthlyMaintenance.description: Monthly maintenance cost of items in Stores. For example your tanks could have a small monthly maintenance cost.

monthlySalary.description:
Monthly salary of "other employees" (represented as items in Stores). This is practically identical to monthlyMaintenance, it just shows on a different place in the \[Monthly costs\] screen.

Note: the "other employees" can't do much (yet), but you could use them for example to increase your Stores capacity (by giving them negative **size**)... representing increased storage effectiveness by hiring specialized logistics personnel (or outsourcing storage completely).

customItemPreviewIndex.description: Allows to have different icons for different types of Vehicles (HWP/SWS) on the \[Craft Info\] screen. Defined either as a single index into the CustomItemPreviews spritesheet, or as a list of indices (for bigger icons).

bigSprite.description: Sprite ID from [BIGOBS.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/BIGOBS.PCK) used to draw this item in a soldier's inventory and UFOpaedia.

specialIconSprite.description: Sprite ID from [SPICONS.DAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/SPICONS.DAT) used to draw this item when used as **specialWeapon** (in Armor definition).

floorSprite.description: Sprite ID from [FLOOROB.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/FLOOROB.PCK) used to draw this item on the floor of a Battlescape tile.

handSprite.description:
Sprite ID from [HANDOB.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/HANDOB.PCK) used to draw this item on a soldier's hand in the Battlescape.

modders: each handobject needs 8 images (8 directions) define the extrasprites accordingly

bulletSprite.description:
Sprite ID from _BulletSprites.png_ used to draw this weapon's projectile on the Battlescape:

*   0 - [Rocket Launcher](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Rocket_Launcher)
*   1 - [Pistol](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Pistol)
*   2 - [Rifle](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Rifle)
*   3 - [Auto Cannon](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Auto_Cannon)
*   4 - [Heavy Cannon](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Heavy_Cannon)
*   5 - [Laser Pistol](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Laser_Pistol)
*   6 - [Laser Rifle](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Laser_Rifle)
*   7 - [Heavy Laser](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Heavy_Laser)
*   8 - [Plasma](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Plasma_Rifle)
*   9 - [Small Launcher](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Small_Launcher)
*   10 - [Blaster Launcher](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Blaster_Launcher)

for modders: the bulletsprite needs to be put into the extraSprites type "Projectiles" the bulletsprite can contain up to 35 3x3 images. The corresponding file id is 35\*\[bulletSprite\]

bulletSpeed.description: How much faster (or slower, if you use a negative number) is a projectile fired from this weapon compared to the average.

explosionSpeed.description: How much faster (or slower, if you use a negative number) is an explosion animated compared to the average.

turretType.description:
Sprite ID from [TANKS.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/TANKS.PCK) of the turret to assign to this tank:

*   0 - [Tank/Cannon](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Tank/Cannon)
*   1 - [Tank/Rocket Launcher](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Tank/Rocket_Launcher)
*   2 - [Tank/Laser Cannon](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Tank/Laser_Cannon)
*   3 - [Hovertank/Plasma](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Hovertank/Plasma)
*   4 - [Hovertank/Launcher](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Hovertank/Launcher)

vaporColor.description: The color offset (0-3 in TFTD) to use for the vapor trail.

vaporDensity.description: The vapor cloud density (number of particles) for the vapor trail.

vaporProbability.description: The vapor cloud probability (0-100%) for the vapor trail.

vaporColorSurface.description:
The color offset (0-3 in TFTD) to use for the vapor trail (for surface deployments, i.e. non-underwater).

Note: The **vaporColor** and **vaporColorSurface** indices are mod-specific since OXCE 7.1, not global anymore. If you want to use a vapor color from a parent mod, you need to specify it explicitly, for example:

```
 vaporColor: { mod: xcom2, index: 0 }

```

instead of

```
 vaporColor: 0

```

vaporDensitySurface.description: The vapor cloud density (number of particles) for the vapor trail (for surface deployments, i.e. non-underwater).

vaporProbabilitySurface.description: The vapor cloud probability (0-100%) for the vapor trail (for surface deployments, i.e. non-underwater).

explosionHitSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when explosion happens. Can be a list with multiple options. If not specified, default explosion sound is used.

reloadSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this ammo/weapon is reloaded. Can be a list with multiple options. If not specified, default reload sound is used.

primeSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this item is primed. Can be a list with multiple options.

unprimeSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this item is unprimed. Can be a list with multiple options.

fireSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this weapon fires. In OXCE, can be a list with multiple options.

hitSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this weapon hits a target. In OXCE, can be a list with multiple options.

psiSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this weapon performs a psi attack (only Panic/MindControl). Can be a list with multiple options.

hitMissSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this weapon misses a psi attack (Use/Panic/MindControl). Can be a list with multiple options.

psiMissSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this weapon misses a psi attack (only Panic/MindControl). Can be a list with multiple options.

meleeSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this weapon attacks a target with melee. In OXCE, can be a list with multiple options.

meleeHitSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this weapon hits a target with melee. In OXCE, can be a list with multiple options.

meleeMissSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this weapon misses a target with melee. Can be a list with multiple options.

hitAnimation.description:
Sprite ID from [SMOKE.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/SMOKE.PCK) used to draw the weapon's "hit explosion". In OXCE, it applies also to Use action of psi weapons.

**NOTE**: Do not define this value for melee/psi weapons, they use [HIT.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/HIT.PCK) and therefore meleeAnimation instead.

**NOTE**: Explosive style weapons (Damage type: smoke, incendiary, stun, & High Explosive) use [X1.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/X1.PCK) and should always be set to the first _above water_ sprite (spriteID for UFO, spriteID + 8 for TFTD). TFTD spritesheet should start with 8 underwater images, followed by 8 above water images.

hitAnimFrames.description:
Allows overriding number of frames for **hitAnimation**.

Defaults are:

*   bullet impact animations = 10 frames
*   melee/psi animations = 4 frames
*   explosion animations = 8 frames

hitMissAnimation.description: Sprite ID from [SMOKE.PCK](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/SMOKE.PCK) used to draw the weapon's "miss explosion". Applies only to Use action of psi weapons.

hitMissAnimFrames.description: Allows overriding number of frames for **hitMissAnimation**.

meleeAnimation.description: Sprite ID from HIT.PCK played when this weapon hits a target with melee.

meleeAnimFrames.description: Allows overriding number of frames for **meleeAnimation**.

meleeMissAnimation.description: Sprite ID from HIT.PCK played when this weapon misses a target with melee.

meleeMissAnimFrames.description: Allows overriding number of frames for **meleeMissAnimation**.

psiAnimation.description: Sprite ID from HIT.PCK played when this weapon hits a target with psi attack (only Panic/MindControl). For Use action on psi weapons, define hitAnimation.

psiAnimFrames.description: Allows overriding number of frames for **psiAnimation**.

psiMissAnimation.description: Sprite ID from HIT.PCK played when this weapon misses a target with psi attack (only Panic/MindControl). For Use action on psi weapons, define hitMissAnimation.

psiMissAnimFrames.description: Allows overriding number of frames for **psiMissAnimation**.

power.description: Weapon power. Usually corresponds to weapon's average damage. For some weapons/items, it determines the range (e.g. for incendiary or smoke).

powerForAnimation.description:
Weapon power used for area-of-effect explosion animation radius. Only used if greater than zero. Doesn't affect any damage calculations, purely visual.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10308.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10308.0.html)

hidePower.description:
Allows hiding the weapon's power (and the entire ammo section) in the Ufopedia.

Note: this can be used for example when the weapon is mostly scripted and the damage info is more confusing than helpful.

damageType.description:
What type of [damage](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Damage) does this weapon do:

*   0 - None
*   1 - Armor Piercing
*   2 - Incendiary
*   3 - High Explosive
*   4 - Laser
*   5 - Plasma
*   6 - Stun
*   7 - Melee
*   8 - Acid
*   9 - Smoke

Notes:

*   A damage type other than 0-9 will do nothing in OpenXcom.
*   In OXCE, there are **10 more damage types** (10-19), which have same default settings as AP/Laser/Plasma/Acid damage types in OpenXcom.

blastRadius.description:
Size of the projectile explosions. 0 for no explosion. -1 to automatically calculate based on weapon power and damage type (actual **blastRadius** currently is capped due [Explosion calculations](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Explosions#Playing_With_Fire)).

Note: blastRadius is deprecated in OXCE. Use **damageAlter.FixRadius** instead. If both are specified, FixRadius is taken.

damageAlter.description:
OpenXcom has 10 damage types and the mechanics of all 10 of them are completely hardcoded. In OXCE, you can use one of these hardcoded damage types as a starting point, but still be able to override all damage aspects for every item. To do this, you always use a pair of attributes for default and override:

*   for normal/primary damage: default is in **damageType** and overrides in **damageAlter**
*   for secondary melee damage: default is in **meleeType** and overrides in **meleeAlter**

Damage override has many attributes, which are all described in [Item Damage Types](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Item_Damage_Types).

Small example:

```
 - type: STR_HWP_DISC_PLASMA_CANNON
   damageType: 5
   damageAlter:
     RandomType: 6
     IgnoreOverKill: false
     ToArmorPre: 0.05
     ToStun: 0.75
     RandomWound: false
     ToWound: 0.12
     FireThreshold: 25

```

meleePower.description: Damage this weapon will do when using melee. This only applies to Firearms, and is only available as stun damage. For normal melee weapons, use regular power and damage types.

meleeType.description: Default damage type for secondary melee attack. Automatically set to damage type 7 (melee) for items with **battleType** = 3 (melee weapon).

meleeAlter.description:
Damage type details for **meleeType**.

Damage override has many attributes, which are all described in [Item Damage Types](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Item_Damage_Types).

strengthApplied.description:
Add the attacking unit's strength to this weapon's damage.

Note: strengthApplied is deprecated in OXCE. Use **damageBonus** instead, which is also more configurable. If both are specified, damageBonus is taken.

damageBonus.description:
Formulae for additional weapon power bonus (not damage bonus!). Defined as a sum of polynomials of up to third degree with various unit stats as parameters :) If you didn't understand the previous sentence, don't be sad, just look at an example. **FIXME**: add more description and examples later.

Example:

```
 - type: STR_EXAMPLE_1
   damageBonus:
     bravery: 2.5
     flatHundred: -1.25
 - type: STR_EXAMPLE_2
   damageBonus:
     firing: [0.0, 0.01]

```

In the first example the power bonus is "250% of soldier's bravery minus 125".

In the second example the power bonus is "0% of firing accuracy plus 1% of firing accuracy squared".

meleeBonus.description: Same as **damageBonus**, but applies to secondary melee attacks.

noLOSAccuracyPenalty.description: The penalty (in percent) to accuracy applied when attacking a unit or a tile outside of LOS. Overrides global setting.

accuracyAimed.description:
The base accuracy (in percent) applied to a soldier's [Firing Accuracy](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Firing_Accuracy) when firing an Aimed/Snap/Auto shot or doing a Melee attack.

Note: in OXCE, it doesn't need to be applied only to firing accuracy, a combination of many other attributes can be used instead, see **accuracyMultiplier** and **meleeMultiplier**.

accuracySnap.description:
The base accuracy (in percent) applied to a soldier's [Firing Accuracy](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Firing_Accuracy) when firing an Aimed/Snap/Auto shot or doing a Melee attack.

Note: in OXCE, it doesn't need to be applied only to firing accuracy, a combination of many other attributes can be used instead, see **accuracyMultiplier** and **meleeMultiplier**.

accuracyAuto.description:
The base accuracy (in percent) applied to a soldier's [Firing Accuracy](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Firing_Accuracy) when firing an Aimed/Snap/Auto shot or doing a Melee attack.

Note: in OXCE, it doesn't need to be applied only to firing accuracy, a combination of many other attributes can be used instead, see **accuracyMultiplier** and **meleeMultiplier**.

accuracyMelee.description:
The base accuracy (in percent) applied to a soldier's [Firing Accuracy](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Firing_Accuracy) when firing an Aimed/Snap/Auto shot or doing a Melee attack.

Note: in OXCE, it doesn't need to be applied only to firing accuracy, a combination of many other attributes can be used instead, see **accuracyMultiplier** and **meleeMultiplier**.

accuracyPanic.description: The accuracy bonus (in flat percent) applied during psi attacks (Panic/MindControl/Use). **accuracyMultiplier** is also used in the calculations.

accuracyMindControl.description: The accuracy bonus (in flat percent) applied during psi attacks (Panic/MindControl/Use). **accuracyMultiplier** is also used in the calculations.

accuracyUse.description: The accuracy bonus (in flat percent) applied during psi attacks (Panic/MindControl/Use). **accuracyMultiplier** is also used in the calculations.

accuracyThrow.description: The base accuracy (in percent) applied when throwing items. See also **throwMultiplier**.

accuracyCloseQuarters.description: The base accuracy (in percent) applied when checking CQC (close quarters combat) score. Overrides global setting. See also **closeQuartersMultiplier**.

blockBothHands.description: Does this weapon block both hands? If true, you **cannot** use this weapon while holding anything in the offhand.

twoHanded.description: Is this weapon two-handed? If true, incurs an accuracy penalty if used with both hands occupied. Note that the handsprite of a twoHanded item is also drawn at a slightly different position than a one handed item.

oneHandedPenalty.description: Override for the global one-handed penalty (which applies only to weapons marked as **twoHanded**). 20% penalty would be encoded as "80" (i.e. 100 minus 20), meaning you will use the weapon at 80% of its usual accuracy.

kneelBonus.description: Override for the global kneel bonus (which applies to all weapons). 15% bonus would be encoded as "115" (i.e. 100 + 15), meaning you will use the weapon at 115% of its usual accuracy.

skillApplied.description:
Is melee accuracy skill applied to the accuracy of an attack made with this item? Only affects melee attacks.

Note: skillApplied is deprecated in OXCE. Use **meleeMultiplier** instead, which is also more configurable. If both are specified, meleeMultiplier is taken.

accuracyMultiplier.description:
Formulae defining the skills (i.e. various units stats) affecting the unit's accuracy when using this item in Aimed/Snap/Auto shots and in Psi attacks (Panic/MindControl/Use).

Example:

```
 - type: STR_EXAMPLE
   accuracyMultiplier:
     firing: 0.0
     throwing: 0.5
     melee: 0.5

```

In this example, the accuracy is based on 50% of unit's throwing skill and 50% of unit's melee skill... and 0% of unit's firing skill.

meleeMultiplier.description: Same as **accuracyMultiplier**, but used for Melee attacks (primary and secondary).

throwMultiplier.description: Same as **accuracyMultiplier**, but used for Throwing.

closeQuartersMultiplier.description: Same as **accuracyMultiplier**, but used for CQC scoring.

waypoints.description: Gives the integer number of waypoints the weapon can use. (eg. [Blaster Launcher](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Blaster_Launcher)). Can also be used to make ammo items use the waypoint system. "-1" means unlimited waypoints.

sprayWaypoints.description:
Waypoints for "spray shots", i.e. autoshots in multiple directions.

More info here: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6423.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6423.0.html)

shotgunPellets.description: Number of projectiles fired per unit of ammunition. (note: due to engine limitations it is currently impossible to draw multiple projectiles in flight.)

shotgunBehavior.description:
Attributes affecting how shotguns work.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4834.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4834.0.html)

shotgunSpread.description:
Attributes affecting how shotguns work.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4834.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4834.0.html)

shotgunChoke.description:
Attributes affecting how shotguns work.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4834.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4834.0.html)

maxRange.description: Maximum range at which this weapon can operate.

aimRange.description: Maximum effective range with this weapon before which range-based dropoff occurs.

snapRange.description: Maximum effective range with snap shot before which range-based dropoff occurs. (ufoextender accuracy only)

autoRange.description: Maximum effective range with auto shot before which range-based dropoff occurs. (ufoextender accuracy only)

minRange.description: Range-based dropoff will work in reverse for ranges below this.

dropoff.description: The value by which the accuracy lowers for each tile after (or before) the thresholds above.

powerRangeThreshold.description: Number of tiles defining the effective range (i.e. range with no power reduction). Beyond this range power reduction is applied.

powerRangeReduction.description: Weapon's power dropoff per tile beyond effective range.

throwRange.description:
Maximum land/surface throwing range (can of course be less if you're weak).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8273.msg132698.html#msg132698](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8273.msg132698.html#msg132698)

underwaterThrowRange.description: Maximum underwater throwing range (can of course be less if you're weak).

clipSize.description: The amount of ammo stored in each weapon clip. If -1 is specified, this weapon has infinite ammo. If specified for a HWP, clipSize determines the maximum amount of shots which can be loaded into the HWP weapon. Use clipsize -1 for melee weapons.

compatibleAmmo.description: List of string IDs of the ammo items that can be loaded on this weapon. If none are specified, the weapon doesn't need ammo.

tuLoad.description:
Amount of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) required to load/unload this item.

**Note**: in OXCE, when loading a weapon, you need to **additionally** pay the cost of moving the ammo from its current inventory slot into a hand slot! Consider that when balancing reload costs.

**Update**: since OXCE v6.2, the OXCE behavior is now turned off by default. It can be enabled using the **extendedItemReloadCost** setting.

tuUnload.description:
Amount of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) required to load/unload this item.

**Note**: in OXCE, when loading a weapon, you need to **additionally** pay the cost of moving the ammo from its current inventory slot into a hand slot! Consider that when balancing reload costs.

**Update**: since OXCE v6.2, the OXCE behavior is now turned off by default. It can be enabled using the **extendedItemReloadCost** setting.

ammo.description:
In OXCE, you can load multiple **different** types of ammo into one gun at the same time. This allows you to create, for example, a rifle with a built-in grenade launcher. There are up to 4 ammo slots, which can be assigned to Aimed/Snap/Auto actions. Going back to the rifle with a grenade launcher example, you could have the rifle with Aimed and Snap and sacrifice the Auto action for implementing let's say a Snap shot for the grenade launcher.

Example:

```
 - type: STR_WEAPON_WITH_4_AMMO_SLOTS
   ammo:
     0:
       compatibleAmmo: [ STR_AMMO_1, STR_AMMO_2 ]
       tuLoad: 5
       tuUnload: 2
     1:
       compatibleAmmo: [ STR_AMMO_3 ]
       tuLoad: 10
       tuUnload: 4
     2:
       compatibleAmmo: [ STR_AMMO_4, STR_AMMO_5 ]
       tuLoad: 10
       tuUnload: 4
     3:
       compatibleAmmo: [ STR_GRENADE_AMMO ]
       tuLoad: 20
       tuUnload: 8

```

autoShots.description: How many auto shots does this weapon fire.

arcingShot.description: Does this weapon fire in an arc?

confAimed.description:
A mapping between actions and ammo slots (see above).

Example:

```
 - type: STR_RIFLE_WITH_A_GRENADE_LAUNCHER
   confAimed:
     shots: 1
     followProjectiles: true    # default
     name: STR_AIMED_SHOT
     ammoSlot: 0
     arcing: false
   confSnap:
     shots: 2
     followProjectiles: false   # the camera stays still while shooting (prevents minigun seizures)
     name: STR_DOUBLE_SNAP_SHOT
     ammoSlot: 0
     arcing: false
   confAuto:
     shots: 1
     name: STR_LAUNCH_GRENADE
     ammoSlot: 3
     arcing: true
   confMelee:
     name: STR_PUNCH_IN_THE_FACE

```

Example 2: Battery-powered weapons: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9293.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9293.0.html)

```
 - type: STR_LASGUN
   compatibleAmmo: [STR_LASGUN_CLIP]
   confAimed:
     spendPerShot: 4        # 4x battery consumption for 2x power
     name: STR_BIG_BOOM
   confSnap:
     name: STR_SMALL_BOOM
   tags:
     BPL_AIMED_2X_POWER: 1  # custom script

```

Example 3: Custom names and custom short names: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9742.msg143229.html#msg143229](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9742.msg143229.html#msg143229)

```
items:
  - type: STR_RIFLE
    confAimed:
      shots: 4
      name: STR_BIG_BOOM
      shortName: STR_BIG_BOOM_SHORT
    confSnap:
      name: STR_SMALL_BOOM
      shortName: STR_SMALL_BOOM_SHORT
    confAuto:
      shots: 2
      name: STR_SMALL_BOOM_X2
      shortName: STR_SMALL_BOOM_X2_SHORT

``````
extraStrings:
  - type: en-US
    strings:
      STR_BIG_BOOM: "Big boom"
      STR_BIG_BOOM_SHORT: "Big (x{0})"
      STR_SMALL_BOOM: "Small boom"
      STR_SMALL_BOOM_SHORT: "Small"
      STR_SMALL_BOOM_X2: "Double boom"
      STR_SMALL_BOOM_X2_SHORT: "Small (x{0})"

```

psiAttackName.description:
Besides panic attack and mind control, weapons of psi-amp type can have also a third type of attack, bound to "use" attributes (for example **costUse**). This attribute defines what should be the name of such attack in the action menu (e.g. Seduce, VooDoo spell, etc.).

Note: also allows to rename motion scanner and mind probe use actions.

primeActionName.description:
Name of the prime action in the action menu. Default is STR\_PRIME\_GRENADE.

Tip: in OXCE more item battleTypes can be primed than in OpenXcom, for example also battleType 10 (Electro-flares).

primeActionMessage.description: Message for the player informing about the priming of an item. Default is STR\_GRENADE\_IS\_ACTIVATED.

unprimeActionName.description: Name of the un-prime action in the action menu.

unprimeActionMessage.description: Message for the player informing about the un-priming of an item. Default is STR\_GRENADE\_IS\_DEACTIVATED.

tuAimed.description: The percentage (0-100%) of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) (from the soldier's total) required to fire an Aimed/Snap/Auto Shot or doing a Melee attack. If 0, the weapon does not have the corresponding attack.

tuSnap.description: The percentage (0-100%) of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) (from the soldier's total) required to fire an Aimed/Snap/Auto Shot or doing a Melee attack. If 0, the weapon does not have the corresponding attack.

tuAuto.description: The percentage (0-100%) of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) (from the soldier's total) required to fire an Aimed/Snap/Auto Shot or doing a Melee attack. If 0, the weapon does not have the corresponding attack.

tuMelee.description: The percentage (0-100%) of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) (from the soldier's total) required to fire an Aimed/Snap/Auto Shot or doing a Melee attack. If 0, the weapon does not have the corresponding attack.

tuUse.description: Amount of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) required to use this item (for non-offensive items). It's a flat rate if **flatRate** is true, otherwise it's a percentage (0-100%).

tuMindControl.description: Amount of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) required to use this item. If not specified, defaults to **tuUse**.

tuPanic.description: Amount of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) required to use this item. If not specified, defaults to **tuUse**.

tuThrow.description: Amount of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) required to throw/prime/unprime this item.

tuPrime.description: Amount of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) required to throw/prime/unprime this item.

tuUnprime.description: Amount of [Time Units](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Time_Units) required to throw/prime/unprime this item.

costAimed.description:
Extended way of defining the cost of item use. Instead of spending only time units, you can also define to spend energy, morale, HP, mana and stun. All costXXX settings override tuXXX settings, for example costAimed overrides tuAimed, etc.

Example:

```
 - type: STR_FUNNY_WEAPON
   costAimed:
     time: 90
     energy: 20
     morale: 65
     mana: 5

```

flatRate.description: If true, then TU costs for this weapon are a flat rate (instead of a percentage of unit TUs).

flatAimed.description:
Extended way of defining if the cost of item use is flat or in percentage. You can now define it for various actions separately. If defined, the more specific setting (e.g. flatAimed) overrides the less specific setting (flatRate).

Example:

```
 - type: STR_FUNNY_WEAPON
   costAimed:
     time: 90
     energy: 20
     mana: 5
   flatAimed:
     time: false   # 90% of TU
     energy: true  # 20 energy (flat)
     mana: true    # 5 mana (flat)

```

flatSnap.description:
Extended way of defining if the cost of item use is flat or in percentage. You can now define it for various actions separately. If defined, the more specific setting (e.g. flatAimed) overrides the less specific setting (flatRate).

experienceTrainingMode.description:
Defines which skill(s) should improve when the soldiers gain experience by hitting enemy units (or healing fatal wounds of any units; or performing psi attacks).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4230.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4230.0.html)

manaExperience.description:
How much mana experience points does the weapon provide. Since OXCE v6.6, this attribute also works on psi-amps (also on unsuccessful attempts).```
 manaExperience: 250    # this means 2 points + 50% chance for a 3rd point (on every hit on hostile unit)

```

recover.description: Is this item recoverable? (gets transported to the X-COM base on mission success)

recoverCorpse.description: Since the **recover** flag applies to both live body (prisoner capture) and dead body (corpse recovery) in OpenXcom, OXCE adds this new flag to allow recovery of a live body, but disable recovery of the corpse (used in mods mostly to ignore dead bodies of killed humans).

recoveryPoints.description: [Score](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Score) gained for recovering this alien artifact.

liveAlien.description: Does this item represent a live alien? (counts towards [Alien Containment](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Alien_Containment))

prisonType.description:
What type of prison (alien containment) facility can accommodate a unit (marked as **liveAlien**) represented by this item.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4830.msg69933.html#msg69933](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4830.msg69933.html#msg69933)

specialType.description:
MCD value in map files to which this item corresponds for mission recovery.

Note: in OXCE, **specialType** >= 200 are reserved for death traps, so please don't use them. More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7671.msg132978.html#msg132978](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7671.msg132978.html#msg132978)

recoveryDividers.description:
Definition how special items (with **specialType** > 1 and **specialType** < 200) should be recovered from the mission.

More info here: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6616.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6616.0.html)

Note: since OXCE v7.2 also negative values can be used and will be treated as multipliers, not dividers: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6616.msg142693.html#msg142693](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6616.msg142693.html#msg142693)

recoveryTransformations.description:
Allows recovering items as other items (for example alien weapons as alien weapon fragments).

More info here: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6868.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6868.0.html)

medikitActionName.description: Name of the use action in the action menu. Default is STR\_USE\_MEDI\_KIT.

medikitType.description:
Defines, which functions can this medikit perform. Possible options:

*   0 = All functions
*   1 = Heal only
*   2 = Stimulant only
*   3 = Painkiller only

medikitTargetSelf.description: Is it possible to use the medikit on oneself (true)? Or only on other units (false)? Ignores other settings.

medikitTargetImmune.description: Is it possible to use the medikit on units that cannot bleed (true)? Or only on other units (false)?

medikitTargetMatrix.description:
Says what targets are allowed for a medikit item. It is a composite attribute (a bit map), individual parts:

*   1 = friendly on the ground
*   2 = friendly standing
*   4 = neutral on the ground
*   8 = neutral standing
*   16 = hostile on the ground
*   32 = hostile standing

So, for example:

*   0 = cannot use on anyone
*   3 (1+2) = can use only on friendlies
*   31 (1+2+4+8+16) = can use on everyone except on standing hostiles/enemies
*   63 = can use on everyone
*   etc.

isConsumable.description:
Will this medikit be automatically refilled at the base (false)? Or will it disappear after the mission, if used at least once (true)?

Note: If you use multiple medikits, they will use the same "combination" algorithm as the guns use for bullet recovery in OpenXcom. Using two medikits let's say just once will not make both of them disappear, because there will be enough "stuff" left to fully recover one of them.

painKiller.description: Amount of painkillers contained in a [Medi-Kit](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Medi-Kit_(EU)).

heal.description: Amount of heals contained in a [Medi-Kit](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Medi-Kit_(EU)).

stimulant.description: Amount of stimulants contained in a [Medi-Kit](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Medi-Kit_(EU)).

woundRecovery.description: Amount of [Fatal Wounds](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Fatal_Wounds) treated by each heal of a [Medi-Kit](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Medi-Kit_(EU)).

healthRecovery.description: Amount of [Health](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Health) recovered by each heal of a [Medi-Kit](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Medi-Kit_(EU)).

stunRecovery.description: Amount of [Stun](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Stun) removed by each stimulant of a [Medi-Kit](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Medi-Kit_(EU)).

energyRecovery.description: Amount of [Energy](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Energy) recovered by each stimulant of a [Medi-Kit](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Medi-Kit_(EU)).

manaRecovery.description: Amount of Mana recovered by each stimulant of a [Medi-Kit](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Medi-Kit_(EU)).

painKillerRecovery.description: Strength of the pain killers (1.0 = 100%). Linear factor affecting vanilla morale recovery (based on lost health).

moraleRecovery.description: Additional points of morale to restore when pain killers are used. Does not depend on lost health (or anything else).

medikitBackground.description:
Sprite ID of the medikit background.

Tip: size and position of buttons can also be adjusted using Interface ruleset (but only globally for all medikit items).

weight.description: [Weight](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Item_Weight) occupied by this item in a soldier's inventory.

invWidth.description: Item width in a soldier's inventory (in grid units).

invHeight.description: Item height in a soldier's inventory (in grid units).

inventoryMoveCost.description:
Cost of moving item between slots. Does not apply to dropping items from hands.```
inventoryMoveCost:
  basePercent: 100 #TU multiplier of base cost

```

fixedWeapon.description: Is this weapon fixed (cannot be dropped from the Inventory)? (it's part of a unit, e.g. tanks and terrorist units)

fixedWeaponShow.description: Should the fixed weapon be drawn on the unit in the Battlescape or not? Normally, the weapon is not drawn (for example Reaper or Cyberdisc weapon... because it's a part of the unit itself), but in mods you may have for example fixed weapons on certain armors, which you want to display as normal "carried" weapons.

defaultInventorySlot.description: An inventory slot where a **fixedWeapon** should be placed when it is created.

defaultInvSlotX.description: A position within the inventory slot where a **fixedWeapon** should be placed when it is created.

defaultInvSlotY.description: A position within the inventory slot where a **fixedWeapon** should be placed when it is created.

supportedInventorySections.description: A list of inventory slots, where this item can be (manually) placed. If empty, all slots are OK.

ignoreInBaseDefense.description:
Items marked with this flag will not appear in the Base Defense mission.

Note: mods, which have items used mostly in Geoscape (e.g. random resources used for manufacturing), but still recoverable from Battlescape should use this flag so that the ground inventory is not spammed by useless junk slowing the game down (significantly! if there are thousands of such items).

ignoreInCraftEquip.description:
Items marked with this flag will not appear in Craft Inventory Equipment screen.

Defaults:

*   true for corpses (battleType=11) and geoscape-only items (battleType=0)
*   false for all other items

specialUseEmptyHand.description: Whether this **specialWeapon** is used when clicking on the empty hand slot in soldier's inventory. Used for punching/kicking with bare hands :)

specialUseEmptyHandShow.description: If true, the sprite of the special weapon will be shown in the empty hand UI (similar to what was done in OXC in April 2020). **specialUseEmptyHand** must be true too.

fuseType.description:
Defines how item priming works.

Possible options:

*   \-3 No priming. Flares always glow if **defaultBehavior** is true.
*   \-2 Can be primed (without timer). Proxies work normally. Grenades explode instantly after throwing. Flares glow only after priming.
*   \-1 Can be primed (for manually specified amount of turns). Grenades explode after set time. Proxies and flares disappear after set time.
*   0-63 Can be primed (for fixed amount of turns).

Defaults:

*   \-2 for proximity grenades
*   \-1 for grenades
*   \-3 for everything else

fuseTriggerEvents.description:
Defines how fuse triggers work. Contains 5 sub-attributes:

*   **defaultBehavior**: everything works as in vanilla
*   **throwTrigger**: timer starts only after throwing
*   **throwExplode**: items explode (grenades) or are removed (other) on throw; affected by **specialChance**
*   **proximityTrigger**: timer starts only after moving into item's proximity
*   **proximityExplode**: item explode (grenades, proxies) or are removed (other) after moving into item's proximity; affected by **specialChance**

Example/Defaults:

```
 fuseTriggerEvents:
   defaultBehavior: true
   throwTrigger: false
   throwExplode: false
   proximityTrigger: false
   proximityExplode: false

```

specialChance.description:
The chance (0-100%) of special effects happening, including:

*   mine triggering (see above)
*   corpse explosion (e.g. of a bio-drone corpse)
*   zombification (e.g. by a chryssalid weapon), see also **zombieUnitChance**
*   unit spawning (e.g. by a brainsucker launcher), see also **spawnUnitChance**
*   item spawning (e.g. by a flare launcher), see also **spawnItemChance**

isExplodingInHands.description: Does the item explode also when still in a unit's inventory?

hiddenOnMinimap.description:
Is the item visible on the minimap?

Tip: use for example for mines hidden underground

isFireExtinguisher.description: Can this item be used to extinguish fire on units?

armor.description: How much damage is needed to destroy this item on the ground.

attraction.description: Represents how likely an alien is to pick up this item. Values below 5 will be ignored (by design).

LOSRequired.description: Does this item require line of sight? (only applies to mind probes and psi-amps)

psiRequired.description: Does using this item require psi skill > 0 ? Items of battleType=9 (psi-amps) have this flag set to _true_ by default.

targetMatrix.description:
Says what targets are allowed for an item. It is a composite attribute (a bit map), individual parts:

*   1 = friendly
*   2 = hostile
*   4 = neutral

So, for example:

*   0 = cannot use on anyone
*   1 = can use only on friendlies
*   6 (2+4) = can use only on hostiles and neutrals
*   etc.

Currently works only for **psi-amps** (default 6) and for **death traps** (default 7).

Note: Mind-controlling friendlies is never possible, hardcoded. Panicking friendlies is possible.

manaRequired.description: Does using this item require mana research unlocked?

underwaterOnly.description: Can this item only be used underwater?

landOnly.description: Can this item only be used on land?

ai.useDelay.description:
1/ Used to override AI delay defined by global settings.

2/ How many times should an AI unit try to perform a melee attack (in the single go)? In vanilla, the unit used the melee attack until the target was neutralized or until it ran out of TUs. This attribute gives you the option to perform "hit and run".

```
 ai:
   useDelay: 1
   meleeHitCount: 15

```

ai.meleeHitCount.description:
1/ Used to override AI delay defined by global settings.

2/ How many times should an AI unit try to perform a melee attack (in the single go)? In vanilla, the unit used the melee attack until the target was neutralized or until it ran out of TUs. This attribute gives you the option to perform "hit and run".

```
 ai:
   useDelay: 1
   meleeHitCount: 15

```

type.description: String ID of the item category name.

hidden.description:
Defines whether this category should be hidden in the filter on the \[Craft Equipment\] screen.

Note: categories not shown to the player are still useful for the modder sometimes.

replaceBy.description:
Defines mapping between item categories.

Note: this is useful when you are still experimenting with the item categorization. If you defined too many categories for example, you can group them together easily here, instead of having to redefine all the items. And if you change your mind later, you can easily ungroup them again.

FixRadius.description:
A blast radius.

*   \-1 = dynamic blast radius
*   0 = no blast radius
*   1+ = fixed blast radius

RandomType.description:
Defines how will the dice be rolled to determine the damage based on power (primary damage calculation).

Possible options (**until OXCE 7.1**):

*   0 = default OpenXcom behavior dependent on damageType (can be like 1, 2, 4 or 5) (affected by **damageRange** (1) and **explosiveDamageRange** (2))
*   1 = hardcoded 0-200% spread (**NOT** affected by **damageRange**)
*   2 = hardcoded 50-150% spread (**NOT** affected by **explosiveDamageRange**)
*   3 = flat damage equal to power
*   4 = random damage in range defined by **fireDamageRange**
*   5 = no damage
*   6 = 0-200% spread (2 dice roll), i.e. 0-100% + 0-100%
*   7 = 50-200% spread

Possible options (**since OXCE 7.1**):

*   0 = behavior dependent on damageType (can be 8, 9, 4 or 5)
*   1 = hardcoded 0-200% spread (**NOT** affected by **damageRange**)
*   2 = hardcoded 50-150% spread (**NOT** affected by **explosiveDamageRange**)
*   3 = flat damage equal to power
*   4 = random damage in range defined by **fireDamageRange**
*   5 = no damage
*   6 = 0-200% spread (2 dice roll), i.e. 0-100% + 0-100%
*   7 = 50-200% spread
*   8 = standard = 0-200% spread (affected by **damageRange**)
*   9 = explosion = 50-150% spread (affected by **explosiveDamageRange**)

ResistType.description: A damage type, i.e. what resistance of the target unit's armor is applied. Same values like **damageType**.

FireBlastCalc.description: Vanilla fire/incendiary blast radius has a special formula. This option turns it on/off.

IgnoreDirection.description: Should the damage calculation ignore from which direction the projectile came? Uses front armor for damage calculation. Used for example for smoke or fire.

IgnoreSelfDestruct.description: Killing using this damage prevents self-destruct (e.g. of Cyberdisc). Used for example on HE, Stun or Melee damage.

IgnorePainImmunity.description: Some units are immune to pain/stun (see **painImmune** on Armor). This allows you to ignore such immunity. Used for example on Stun damage.
