*   2 = [Burns Floor](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Silacoid)
*   3 = [Burns Floor and explodes on Death](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Bio-Drone)

Note: Explodes on Death refers to when the unit is collapsing. This can be either be due to the unit not having any remaining HPs or that the stun level exceeds its HP. Only when the damageType is set to DT\_STUN, DT\_HE, DT\_IN or DT\_MELEE (OpenXcom) or the value for damageAlter **IgnoreSelfDestruct** on the damaging item is set to true (OpenXcom Extended), the unit will **not** explode.

spawnUnit.description: String ID of the unit used to respawn on death (e.g. [Zombies](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Zombie) respawn as [Chrysallids](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Chrysallid)).

livingWeapon.description:
Is this unit a living weapon?

If yes, it ignores any weapon loadout associated with its rank in the alien deployment and only attacks with a weapon derived from its race name (must be marked as **fixedWeapon**). The weapon's name is the unit's race name without the first 4 letters (STR\_) and with a suffix (\_WEAPON). For example: STR\_REAPER => REAPER\_WEAPON.

meleeWeapon.description: This unit's built-in melee weapon (e.g. Lobsterman's Claws). Does not appear in the inventory.

psiWeapon.description: This unit's built-in psi weapon. Ignored if the unit doesn't have any psi skill. Does not appear in the inventory.

capturable.description:
Can this unit be captured alive?

Note: units which cannot be captured alive are insta-killed when they fall unconscious.

liveAlien.description:
String ID of the item that will be used to represent the live/captured alien in the base/geoscape.

Notes:

*   OXC compatibility: by default **liveAlien** is the same as **type** (but only if such an item exists)
*   you can use an empty string **""** to explicitly indicate that there is no live alien

builtInWeaponSets.description: A set of lists of weapons this unit can come pre-equipped with. Game will pick one set "at random" (randomness comes from the current alien tech level definition). These weapons WILL appear in inventory slots (references items).

moraleLossWhenKilled.description:
Percentage modifier for morale loss when this unit is killed.

Tip: set for example 50% for cannon fodder and 300% for VIPs.

deathSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this unit dies. No value means no sound upon death. A list of sound IDs can be used too, the game then chooses one randomly each time.

selectUnitSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this unit is manually selected. A list of sound IDs can be used too.

startMovingSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this unit starts moving. A list of sound IDs can be used too.

selectWeaponSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this unit's weapon is selected. A list of sound IDs can be used too.

annoyedSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this unit is repeatedly manually selected. A list of sound IDs can be used too.

panicSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this unit panics. A list of sound IDs can be used too.

berserkSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this unit berserks. A list of sound IDs can be used too.

aggroSound.description:
Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this unit aggros.

In OXCE, a list of sound IDs can be used too, the game then chooses one randomly each time.

moveSound.description: Sound ID from [BATTLE.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when this unit moves.

showFullNameInAlienInventory.description:
Defines whether the \[Alien Inventory\] screen (accessible via middle-click on a unit) should display a unit's type/name or just a unit's race.

Possible options:

*   \-1 = use global setting (show the race by default)
*   0 = show the race (e.g. Sectoid)
*   1 = show the type (e.g. Sectoid Leader)

pickUpWeaponsMoreActively.description:
Allows AI to pick up weapons more actively. More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6882.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6882.0.html)

Possible options:

*   \-1 = use global setting (disabled by default)
*   0 = disabled
*   1 = enabled

avoidsFire.description:
Allows AI to not be afraid to pathfind through fire. More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,11212.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,11212.0.html)

Possible options:

*   false = can pathfind through fire without problems
*   true = can pathfind through fire, but with a big penalty (usually this results in not walking through fire)

If not defined, vanilla algorithm is used, which allows pathfinding through fire to units with **specab: 2** (e.g. Silacoid) and **specab: 3** (e.g. Bio-Drone).

id.description: String ID of the alien race name.

members.description:
Alien crew associated with this alien race (e.g. race units + terrorist units), defined by a list of unit string IDs. Order here will define rank in terms of deployment. Generally speaking the order is:

*   0 - Commander
*   1 - Leader
*   2 - Engineer
*   3 - Medic
*   4 - Navigator
*   5 - Soldier
*   6 - Terrorist 1
*   7 - Terrorist 2

but of course, not all races have all ranks, so the "fill in" rank would be listed multiple times (see Ethereals).

membersRandom.description: Alternative to **members**. Instead of defining just a single unit type per alien rank, you can define any number of unit types here and one will be chosen randomly (each time a new unit is generated). To increase a chance of a certain unit type being selected, you can add it multiple times.

retaliationMission.description: String ID of an alien mission, that can be generated after a dogfight against this race. If empty, a random retaliation mission will be used instead.

retaliationMissionWeights.description:
A weighted list of alien missions that can be generated after a dogfight against this race, listed by "number of months passed". If used, **retaliationMission** is ignored.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9496.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9496.0.html)

retaliationAggression.description:
A flat percentage to modify the dogfight retaliation odds for this race. Positive value increases odds, negative value decreases odds.

Example: Normal retaliation odds for Veteran difficulty (in UFO) are 12%. If this number is set to 20, the odds will increase to 32%.

baseCustomMission.description:
String ID of an alien deployment (**not alien mission!!**) override for all alien bases inhabited by this alien race.

Applies to:

*   all starting condition checks
*   additional mission description, see **alertDescription**
*   everything done during the Battlescape generation
*   everything done during the Debriefing

Does **not** apply to anything else (that depends on alien deployment), for example:

*   alien base supply mission
*   alien base hunt missions
*   alien base upgrades
*   etc.

baseCustomDeploy.description:
A lighter version of **baseCustomMission**, which only overrides the [deployment data](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Deployment_Data) used during the Battlescape generation.

Note: if both **baseCustomMission** and **baseCustomDeploy** are specified, [deployment data](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Deployment_Data) is taken from **baseCustomDeploy** and everything else is taken from **baseCustomMission**.

type.description: Name of a script item (reinforcements wave). Doesn't really do anything, it's used to organize your scripts and help debugging.

isHidden.description:
If enabled, the mission will not appear in the mission list in New Battle GUI. Doesn't work when debug is enabled in options.cfg.

Since OXCE 7.6 there is also a special use for craft preview, more details: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10370.msg147475.html#msg147475](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10370.msg147475.html#msg147475)

customUfo.description:
String ID of a UFO to be used in mapscripts in addUFO command. This allows to reuse the same script for many deployments.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7631.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7631.0.html)

startingCondition.description:
String ID of a [starting condition](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Battle_Starting_Conditions) for missions using this deployment.

Note: overrides any globe texture starting condition.

enviroEffects.description:
String ID of [enviro effects](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Battle_Enviro_Effects) for missions using this deployment.

Note: overrides any mission terrain enviro effects.

data.description: List of deployment data for each alien rank in this reinforcements wave (see above).

reinforcements.description: List of scripted reinforcement waves (see below).

width.description: Width of the Battlescape map in grid units.

length.description: Length of the Battlescape map in grid units.

height.description: Vertical height of the Battlescape map in grid units.

civilians.description: Maximum number of civilians to spawn. The actual number of civilians spawned will be between 50-100% of the specified maximum.

civilianSpawnNodeRank.description:
Map node rank to spawn civilians on.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6477.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6477.0.html)

civiliansByType.description: A list of additional civilians to spawn, each list item is defined by a civilian type ID and a maximum number (type: number). The actual number of civilians spawned will be again between 50-100% of the specified maximum, but this time the 50% is rounded up (for **civilians** attribute it is rounded down).

terrains.description: List of string IDs of the [terrains](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Terrains) to choose from when generating the map. Not used for UFO land/crash sites, terrain comes from the Geoscape globe texture.

shade.description: Shade of the map (0-15, where 0 is full daytime and 15 is full nighttime). If not specified (e.g. for UFO land/crash sites), the shade comes from the Geoscape globe.

minShade.description: Minimum shade of the map (0-15). Used only when **shade** is not set, to adjust the shade coming from the Geoscape globe.

maxShade.description: Maximum shade of the map (0-15). Used only when **shade** is not set, to adjust the shade coming from the Geoscape globe.

nextStage.description: String ID of the next deployment stage to use after this one, for multi-stage missions.

race.description: Sets (overrides) the alien race to use when generating the map.

randomRace.description: Sets (overrides) the alien race to use when generating the map. Unlike **race** attribute, this is a list of multiple possible races; one is chosen randomly at runtime.

finalDestination.description: Sets whether this mission is where you send your [uber-craft](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Avenger) to win the game.

winCutscene.description: Sets the cutscene to play when you win the mission. If set to "winGame" or "loseGame", the player will be returned to the main menu after the cutscene plays.

loseCutscene.description: Sets the cutscene to play when you lose the mission. If set to "winGame" or "loseGame", the player will be returned to the main menu after the cutscene plays.

abortCutscene.description: Sets the cutscene to play when you abort the mission. If set to "winGame" or "loseGame", the player will be returned to the main menu after the cutscene plays.

script.description: Map script used to generate the map (overrides the map script from terrain definition).

mapScripts.description: List of map scripts used to generate the map (overrides **script** and any of the map scripts from terrain definition). One is chosen at random during map generation.

alert.description: String ID of the message to display in the alert popup when this mission spawns on the Geoscape.

alertBackground.description: String ID of the background image to use in the alert popup when this mission spawns on the Geoscape.

alertDescription.description: String ID of the additional mission description (displayed when clicking on the \[Info\] button on the \[Target Info\] screen).

alertSound.description: Sound ID from GEO.CAT to be played when the \[Mission Detected\] screen pops up.

briefing.description: Data for the reinforcements briefing (see above).

markerName.description: String ID that identifies this mission type on the Geoscape.

markerIcon.description: What icon should be used to represent this base/site (taken from GlobeMarkers section in extraSprites)

depth.description: \[_min_, _max_\] -- Defines the depth range to randomly choose from for this mission.

duration.description:
\[_min_, _max_\] -- Minimum and maximum duration of this mission on the Geoscape (in hours).

**Important**: mission duration should be at least 2 hours... if it's just 1 hour and it spawns at the whole hour, it also despawns at the same moment... and crashes the game!

music.description: The ID of the music to play.

points.description: Negative score applied for each day this mission is active (applied daily for bases, or every half hour for mission sites)

unlockedResearch.description:
String ID of a research topic that will be granted for free (only on mission success).  

String ID of a research topic that will be granted for free (only on mission failure).  
String ID of a research topic that will be granted for free (only on mission site despawn).

Note: there will be no Ufopaedia article shown nor any other related effect; the research will just be silently added into the list of finished research projects.

unlockedResearchOnFailure.description:
String ID of a research topic that will be granted for free (only on mission success).  

String ID of a research topic that will be granted for free (only on mission failure).  
String ID of a research topic that will be granted for free (only on mission site despawn).

Note: there will be no Ufopaedia article shown nor any other related effect; the research will just be silently added into the list of finished research projects.

unlockedResearchOnDespawn.description:
String ID of a research topic that will be granted for free (only on mission success).  

String ID of a research topic that will be granted for free (only on mission failure).  
String ID of a research topic that will be granted for free (only on mission site despawn).

Note: there will be no Ufopaedia article shown nor any other related effect; the research will just be silently added into the list of finished research projects.

successEvents.description:
Weighted lists of events that spawn instantly after a trigger (mission success, mission failure or mission site despawn).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10319.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10319.0.html)

despawnEvents.description:
Weighted lists of events that spawn instantly after a trigger (mission success, mission failure or mission site despawn).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10319.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10319.0.html)

failureEvents.description:
Weighted lists of events that spawn instantly after a trigger (mission success, mission failure or mission site despawn).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10319.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10319.0.html)

counterSuccess.description:
String IDs of custom counters for various battle outcomes. The counter values can be used in Arc/Mission/Event scripts (see **missionMarkerName**).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

counterFailure.description:
String IDs of custom counters for various battle outcomes. The counter values can be used in Arc/Mission/Event scripts (see **missionMarkerName**).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

counterDespawn.description:
String IDs of custom counters for various battle outcomes. The counter values can be used in Arc/Mission/Event scripts (see **missionMarkerName**).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

counterAll.description:
String IDs of custom counters for various battle outcomes. The counter values can be used in Arc/Mission/Event scripts (see **missionMarkerName**).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

decreaseCounterSuccess.description:
String IDs of custom counters for various battle outcomes. The counter values can be used in Arc/Mission/Event scripts (see **missionMarkerName**).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

decreaseCounterFailure.description:
String IDs of custom counters for various battle outcomes. The counter values can be used in Arc/Mission/Event scripts (see **missionMarkerName**).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

decreaseCounterDespawn.description:
String IDs of custom counters for various battle outcomes. The counter values can be used in Arc/Mission/Event scripts (see **missionMarkerName**).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

decreaseCounterAll.description:
String IDs of custom counters for various battle outcomes. The counter values can be used in Arc/Mission/Event scripts (see **missionMarkerName**).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

missionBountyItem.description:
String ID of an item that will be added to base stores for free (only if the mission is finished successfully).

Note: the player will be informed in the Debriefing screen.

missionBountyItemCount.description: Defines how many **missionBountyItem** items should be added.

bughuntMinTurn.description: Possibility to override global bug hunt minimum turn for this alien deployment only (usually to set a higher number for longer missions).

alienBase.description: Does this deployment correspond to an alien base assault? Used only in New Battle mode.

genMission.description:
Which alien mission should this base generate?

Usually supply mission - can be used to generate any mission type except Mission Sites (UFO will be generated, but the site will never appear)

genMissionFreq.description: Daily chance for the base mission to be generated.

genMissionLimit.description: Maximum number of times the **genMission** can be generated.

genMissionRaceFromAlienBase.description:
True = use alien race from the alien base (vanilla behavior); False = use alien race from the mission's **raceWeights** (if not empty)

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,5717.msg143441.html#msg143441](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,5717.msg143441.html#msg143441)

baseSelfDestructCode.description: Discovering this research topic destroys all corresponding alien bases immediately.

baseDetectionRange.description: Radar detection range (in nautical miles) for an alien base. If more than 0, the base actively scans for xcom craft and generates xcom craft hunt missions.

baseDetectionChance.description: Chance (0-100%) of the base radar detecting a craft that enters its range.

huntMissionMaxFrequency.description: The maximum frequency (in minutes) of hunt missions generated by an alien base.

huntMissionRaceFromAlienBase.description: True = use alien race from the alien base; False = use alien race from the mission's **raceWeights** (if not empty)

huntMissionWeights.description: A weighted list of hunt missions a base can generate, listed by "number of months passed".

alienBaseUpgrades.description:
A weighted list of alien base upgrades, listed by "number of months passed".

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6430.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6430.0.html)

resetAlienBaseAgeAfterUpgrade.description: Defines whether the age of an alien base should be reset after an upgrade. Note: when upgrading from type A to type B, the flag is read from **type A**.

resetAlienBaseAge.description: Defines whether the age of an alien base should be reset after an upgrade. Note: when upgrading from type A to type B, the flag is read from **type B**.

upgradeRace.description: Defines the new race for an alien base after an upgrade (into this type). Note: when upgrading from type A to type B, the flag is read from **type B**.

fakeUnderwaterSpawnChance.description: Chance (in percent) for the alien base to spawn on "fake underwater" globe texture.

allowObjectiveRecovery.description: Can map objects of type defined by **objectiveType** be recovered or not?

objectiveType.description: Defines which type of MCD to check for when tallying mission objectives.

objectivesRequired.description: How many of the tile types (defined in **objectiveType**) must be destroyed in order for the mission to be considered a success.

objectivePopup.description: Defines the message that will appear between turns, after the objective requirements have been fulfilled.

objectiveComplete.description: The string and score adjustment to be shown on the mission debriefing.

objectiveFailed.description: The string and score adjustment to be shown on the mission debriefing.

despawnPenalty.description: How many points the aliens will receive when this site despawns due to XCom negligence.

abortPenalty.description: How many points the xcom will lose when this mission is aborted.

cheatTurn.description:
When the aliens became aware of all your units (in vanilla it was after turn 20)

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9051.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,9051.0.html)

turnLimit.description: The amount of turns before the mission ends automatically.

chronoTrigger.description:
What happens when the timer reaches 0. Possible values:

*   0 = Lose
*   1 = Abort
*   2 = Win
*   3 = Win + all enemies surrender

escapeType.description:
Which type of tiles can be used for escape. Possible values:

*   0 = None
*   1 = Exit tiles
*   2 = Entry tiles
*   3 = Either

vipSurvivalPercentage.description: How many VIPs need to survive for the mission to be counted as successful.

markCiviliansAsVIP.description:
Should all civilians be marked as VIPs?

Besides this, you can use also the **vip** attribute on the unit level to have finer control over VIPs (and a possibility to mark also player-controlled summoned units as VIPs).

keepCraftAfterFailedMission.description: Defines whether the craft should be lost after a failed mission or not. Useful for example for timed missions where the craft doesn't wait for you (e.g. escape/extraction missions).

alienRank.description: [Rank](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Alien_Rank) associated with this deployment data, as defined by the order of the race in question (see above)

customUnitType.description: Allows to hardcode a unit to spawn, instead of taking the corresponding alien race member based on **alienRank**.

lowQty.description: Minimum quantity of aliens to spawn on beginner/experienced.

highQty.description: Minimum quantity of aliens to spawn on superhuman. (minimum quantity for veteran/genius is the median of this and the previous value)

medQty.description:
Gives the ability to define more granular enemy numbers by difficulty. Defines quantity of aliens to spawn on veteran difficulty. Affects also experienced and genius difficulty.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10304.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10304.0.html)

dQty.description: Delta in Quantity, i.e. random number of aliens to spawn on top of the minimum (all difficulties).

extraQty.description: Functionally identical to dQty, spawns a random number of additional aliens.

percentageOutsideUfo.description:
Percentage (0-100%) of aliens to spawn outside of the UFO (in UFO land/crash sites).

For **reinforcements**, this attribute is reused/misused to specify whether to spawn enemies (use value 0) or civilians (use any other value than 0).

itemSets.description: Three lists (one for each alien technology level) of [items](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Items) (string IDs) for the aliens to equip.

extraRandomItems.description:
One or more item lists with extra equipment. One item will be chosen from each list randomly.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7055.msg111746.html#msg111746](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7055.msg111746.html#msg111746)

palette.description: The color swatch to use from [BACKPALS.DAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/BACKPALS.DAT).

textOffset.description: Number of pixels to vertically offset the briefing text. Larger values move the text further down the screen.

title.description: String ID for a custom briefing title text. Defaults to the same name as the _alienDeployment_.

desc.description: String ID for a custom briefing description text. Defaults to the same name as the _alienDeployment + \_BRIEFING_.

cutscene.description: Sets the cutscene to play before the mission briefing.

showCraft.description: Whether to show the name of craft that arrived at the mission site.

showTarget.description: Whether to display the mission target name.

minDifficulty.description: Minimum difficulty on which this reinforcements wave will apply.

maxDifficulty.description: Maximum difficulty on which this reinforcements wave will apply.

objectiveDestroyed.description: Should this reinforcements wave only apply after mission objectives are destroyed?

turns.description:
A list of turns on which this reinforcements wave should apply. Ignored if **objectiveDestroyed** is true.

Note: since OXCE v7.2, also turn 0 (zero) can be used. It spawns reinforcements before the first player turn (i.e. before the battle).

minTurn.description: Minimum turn on which this reinforcements wave should apply. Ignored if **objectiveDestroyed** is true or **turns** is not empty.

maxTurn.description: Maximum turn on which this reinforcements wave should apply. Ignored if **objectiveDestroyed** is true or **turns** is not empty.

executionOdds.description: Execution odds (in percent) for this reinforcements wave.

maxRuns.description: How many times is this reinforcements wave allowed to be repeated.

useSpawnNodes.description: Can map nodes be used to spawn reinforcements? Recommended value is true.

mapBlockFilterType.description:
Which map blocks can be used to spawn reinforcements. Possible values:

*   0 = all blocks
*   1 = blocks marked in the map script
*   2 = blocks specified by **spawnBlocks**
*   3 = both union (blocks marked in the map script or specified by **spawnBlocks**)
*   4 = both intersection (blocks marked in the map script AND specified by **spawnBlocks** at the same time)

spawnBlocks.description:
A list of codes specifying which blocks can be used for spawning. Empty = all. Possible values:

*   EDGES = all map edges
*   NORTH = north map edge
*   WEST = west map edge
*   SOUTH = south map edge
*   EAST = east map edge
*   NW = north-west map corner
*   NE = north-east map corner
*   SW = south-west map corner
*   SE = south-east map corner

spawnBlockGroups.description: A list of block groups specifying which blocks can be used for spawning. Empty = all.

spawnNodeRanks.description: A list of node ranks specifying which map nodes can be used for spawning. Empty = all.

spawnZLevels.description: A list of Z-levels where units are allowed to spawn. Empty = all.

randomizeZLevels.description: Should the game try to spawn units on Z-levels in order specified by **spawnZLevels**, or in random order? Doesn't apply to spawning on map nodes.

minDistanceFromXcomUnits.description: Used to spawn reinforcements away from any xcom units. Use with caution!

maxDistanceFromBorders.description: Used to spawn reinforcements near the map borders. Allowed values are from 1 to 9 (tiles).

forceSpawnNearFriend.description: If everything else fails, should the game spawn reinforcements next to a random existing unit of the same faction?

type.description: String ID of the starting condition.

defaultArmor.description: If a soldier's armor is not permitted on a mission (see **allowedArmors** and **forbiddenArmors** below), it will be replaced by a default armor. Default armor is defined for each soldier type separately as a weighted list of possible armor replacements. There is also a special armor ID "noChange" representing no change needed (i.e. giving you a chance to keep the original armor even if it is not allowed... don't ask me why, ask modders!)

allowedArmors forbiddenArmors.description: A list of allowed/forbidden armors for a mission. Only one of these two attributes can be used.

forbiddenArmorsInNextStage.description:
A list of forbidden armors for a mission (in second stage).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10194.msg149818.html#msg149818](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10194.msg149818.html#msg149818)

allowedVehicles forbiddenVehicles.description: A list of allowed/forbidden vehicles (HWP/SWS) for a mission. Not permitted vehicles will stay at the base. Only one of these two attributes can be used.

allowedItems forbiddenItems.description: A list of allowed/forbidden items (weapons, equipment, etc.) for a mission. Not permitted items will stay at the base. Only one of these two attributes can be used.

allowedItemCategories forbiddenItemCateg.description: A list of allowed/forbidden item categories (categories are freely definable by modders) for a mission. This is used to simplify/shorten the definition of allowed/forbidden items. Only one of these two attributes can be used.

allowedCraft forbiddenCraft.description: A list of allowed/forbidden craft for a mission. Not permitted craft cannot target the mission destination at all. Only one of these two attributes can be used.

allowedSoldierTypes forbiddenSoldierType.description: A list of allowed/forbidden soldier types for a mission. If there are any not permitted soldier types onboard a craft, it won't be able to target the mission destination at all. Only one of these two attributes can be used.

requiredItems.description: A list of items (and their quantities) required for a mission (e.g. a skeleton key from EU2012).

craftTransformations.description:
A list of craft transformations (oldCraft: newCraft).

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4444.msg148706.html#msg148706](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4444.msg148706.html#msg148706)

destroyRequiredItems.description: Defines whether required items should be destroyed or not (when craft landing is confirmed).

requireCommanderOnboard.description: Defines whether a commander must be present onboard for this mission.

type.description: String ID of the enviro effects.

paletteTransformations.description: A list of palette transformations (oldPaletteName: newPaletteName) to apply during the mission (or mission stage). New palettes should be similar to original palettes, they should only convey visual effects like pollution, underwater environment, etc. For UFO-based mods only one palette (PAL\_BATTLESCAPE) needs to be changed, for TFTD-based mods up to 4 palettes (for each depth).

environmentalConditions.description:
A set of [environmental conditions](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Environmental_Conditions) (one for each faction: STR\_FRIENDLY, STR\_HOSTILE or STR\_NEUTRAL), see below. Environmental conditions define a special effect applied to each unit of a given faction at the beginning of their turn. This can be for example damage in toxic environment, stun in harsh environment, morale decrease in tough battles, etc.

Note: the player is informed about the effects applied on the \[Next Turn\] screen.

armorTransformations.description:
A list of armor transformations (oldArmorName: newArmorName) to apply during the mission (or mission stage). This can be only visual (e.g. replace helmetless armors with armors with a helmet when going underwater or in space) or also functional (effectively changing unit's stats and armor properties). The change is only temporary and reverted to original armor when the mission ends.

Note: if the armor is transformed, it is not checked if it is allowed or not and it is not replaced with default armor either.

mapBackgroundColor.description: Possibility to change the color of the background outside of the map boundaries. Used for example to visually indicate the type of environment.

ignoreAutoNightVisionUserSetting.description: Allows the modder to turn off the automatic night vision user option for this particular environment.

inventoryShockIndicator.description: String ID of the shock indicator sprite (in the inventory). Used to override the global one, for example in normal environment it can indicate body shock, in underwater environment drowning and in space suffocating.

mapShockIndicator.description: String ID of the shock indicator sprite (on the map). Used to override the global one.

globalChance.description: Chance (0-100%) that this environmental condition will be turned on. Dice roll is performed only once, when the battle starts.

chancePerTurn.description: Chance (0-100%) that a unit will be affected. Dice roll is performed each turn, for each unit separately.

firstTurn.description: When should the environmental condition start affecting the units. XCOM units cannot be affected before their first turn (aliens and civilians can).

lastTurn.description: When should the environmental condition stop affecting the units.

message.description: String ID of the message displayed on the \[Next Turn\] screen, explaining to the player what is happening.

weaponOrAmmo.description: The item (a weapon or ammo) that defines the actual effect. Compared to normal weapons, there are some limitations. See notes below.

side.description:
The unit side where the effect is applied. Possible options:

*   \-1 = random,
*   0 = front
*   1 = left
*   2 = right
*   3 = rear
*   4 = under

bodyPart.description:
The unit body part where the effect is applied. Possible options:

*   \-1 = random
*   0 = head
*   1 = torso
*   2 = right arm
*   3 = left arm
*   4 = right leg
*   5 = left leg

type.description: String ID of the custom palette.

target.description:
String ID of the target palette:

*   for global palette replacement, use one of the game's default palette names:
    *   **UFO**: BACKPALS.DAT, PAL\_BASESCAPE, PAL\_BATTLEPEDIA, PAL\_BATTLESCAPE, PAL\_GEOSCAPE, PAL\_GRAPHS and PAL\_UFOPAEDIA
    *   **TFTD**: BACKPALS.DAT, PAL\_BASESCAPE, PAL\_BATTLESCAPE, PAL\_BATTLESCAPE\_1, PAL\_BATTLESCAPE\_2, PAL\_BATTLESCAPE\_3, PAL\_GEOSCAPE and PAL\_GRAPHS
*   for additional palettes, just use the same name as for **type**

file.description: Path to a file containing the palette definition, in JASC format.

palette.description: Alternative to **file**. You can specify the palette directly in the ruleset using a list of RGB values. Using this method, you don't have to specify all 256 colors; you can also use it to just change a few colors and leave the rest unchanged.

name.description: String ID of the research project's name.

lookup.description:
String ID of the research project's display result (used when multiple projects give the same result, e.g. researching Sectoid Engineer and Sectoid Navigator both give the same live Sectoid info in the Ufopaedia).

**Warning**: DON'T use the same **lookup** as **name**! Leave **lookup** empty/undefined in such case.

cutscene.description: The name of the cutscene to play when this project is completed.

spawnedItem.description:
Item to be added to base stores, when the research is completed.

Tip: allows you to create unique items in limited quantities (e.g. special weapons, keys to special missions, etc.). Don't forget to inform the player in the pedia article!

spawnedItemCount.description: Defines how many **spawnedItem** items should be added.

spawnedItemList.description: A list of items to be added to base stores, when the research is completed.

spawnedEvent.description: Geoscape event to be scheduled, when the research is completed.

cost.description: Number of man-days (on average, the final time will be 50-150% this value) required to complete this project.

dependencies.description: List of research projects that can unlock access to this one. If the full list is researched, or if one of the projects on the list "unlocks" this one, it becomes available.

unlocks.description: List of research projects unlocked, regardless of other dependencies, but not requirements, by completing this project (for example, any live alien unlocks "Alien Origins").

disables.description:
A list of research projects disabled by completing this project.

Notes:

*   this is one of the ways how to branch your "story", e.g. create alternative endings
*   it can also be used to hide obsolete stuff in the market, workshop, pedia, etc.
*   disabled topics can be re-enabled using **reenables**

reenables.description: A list of research projects re-enabled by completing this project.

getOneFree.description:
List of "bonus" research projects that may be granted when completing this project. Examples: alien navigators (give random alien mission info), medics (give random alien interrogation or autopsy), engineers (give random UFO type info).

**getOneFree** only works when the research project is completed in a Laboratory. All other means of obtaining a research topic ignore **getOneFree**.

getOneFreeProtected.description:
A list of additional "bonus" research projects that may be granted when completing this project. Each topic in the list is "protected" by another topic, which allows you finer control over when the player gets the bonus.

For example: you could divide the topics into early-game, mid-game and late-game and protect each group by some "gateway topic".

**getOneFreeProtected** only works when the research project is completed in a Laboratory. All other means of obtaining a research topic ignore **getOneFreeProtected**.

sequentialGetOneFree.description: Should the topics from **getOneFree** and **getOneFreeProtected** be given randomly (false) or sequentially (true).

requires.description: List of research projects absolutely required before this project can be unlocked. For example, "The Martian Solution" will not even be considered for unlocking until AFTER "Alien Origins" is completed.

requiresBaseFunc.description: A list of services (for a given base) required to start this project.

needItem.description: Does this project require an [item](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Items) of the same name?

destroyItem.description: Will this item be destroyed (removed from stores) after research is finished?

unlockFinalMission.description: If true, this research topic allows to send a spacecraft to the final mission.

increaseCounter.description: A list of object counters to increase when the project is completed.

decreaseCounter.description: A list of object counters to decrease when the project is completed.

name.description: String ID of the new manufacturing project's name.

category.description:
String ID of the manufacturing project's category.

Important: craft manufacturing projects MUST be defined in the STR\_CRAFT category.

requires.description: List of [topics](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Research) (string IDs) that must be researched to unlock this project. If none are specified, this project is unlocked from the start.

requiresBaseFunc.description: A list of services required (in the given base) to be able to start this project.

space.description: Amount of [Workshop](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Workshop) space required to begin this project.

time.description: Number of man-hours required per production.

points.description: [Score](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Score) earned/lost for completing every production item.

refund.description:
Whether the resources needed for a project should be refunded when a project is cancelled before completion.

Notes:

*   if enabled, the _STOP PRODUCTION_ button is replaced by a _REFUND_ button
*   in case you didn't know: in vanilla, when you started a manufacture project (even with 0 engineers allocated and no time passed yet), all the resources were irrevocably gone

requiredItems.description: List of [items](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Items) required and consumed per production.

producedItems.description:
List of [items](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Items) manufactured per production. If not specified, defaults to 1 item with the same string ID as the manufacture project.

Note: It's possible to add only one craft per list.

randomProducedItems.description:
List of item sets with weights. One item set is chosen randomly for production.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6867.msg109423.html#msg109423](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6867.msg109423.html#msg109423)

spawnedPersonType.description:
Allows to "manufacture" soldiers, scientists and engineers. More info here: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4187.msg78212.html#msg78212](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4187.msg78212.html#msg78212)

Note: you can't use existing soldiers as "input" here, only items or prisoners. For transformation of existing soldiers (e.g. from normal humans to MECs), please use the [Soldier Transformation](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Soldier_Transformation) functionality and ruleset.

spawnedPersonName.description: When "manufacturing" a soldier, you can (optionally) specify also his/her name. The name is translatable.

spawnedSoldier.description:
When "manufacturing" a soldier, you can (optionally) specify overrides for any of the soldier's attributes. Uses the same syntax as the saved games. Cannot override soldier's ID and name.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8615.msg132649.html#msg132649](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8615.msg132649.html#msg132649)

startFrom.description: String ID of the manufacturing project to copy.

breakDownItems.description: List of manufacture projects (string IDs) to break down. Break down is recursive (i.e. repeats until there is nothing more to break down).

breakDownRequires.description: Whether the research requirements should be broken down or not.

breakDownRequiresBaseFunc.description: Whether the base services requirements should be broken down or not.

id.description: String ID of the article name. This must match the ID of the object associated with this article, if applicable.

title.description: String ID of the article title. If omitted, the **id** is used.

type_id.description:
Type of this article:

*   1 = [Craft](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Craft)
*   2 = [Craft Armaments](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Craft_Armaments)
*   3 = [HWP](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/HWP)
*   4 = [Equipment](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Equipment_(EU))
*   5 = [Armour](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Armour)
*   6 = [Base Facilities](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Base_Facilities)
*   7 = Text & Image (eg. [Alien Life Forms](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Alien_Life_Forms), [UFO Components](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/UFO_Components))
*   8 = Text (eg. [Alien Research](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Alien_Research))
*   9 = [UFO](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/UFO)
*   10 = [TFTD](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/TFTD)
*   11 = TFTD [Subs](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Subs)
*   12 = TFTD [Sub Armaments](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Sub_Armaments)
*   13 = TFTD [Submersible Weapons Systems](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Submersible_Weapons_Systems)
*   14 = TFTD [Equipment](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Equipment_(TFTD))
*   15 = TFTD [Armour](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Armour_(TFTD))
*   16 = TFTD [Base Facilities](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Base_Facilities_(TFTD))
*   17 = TFTD [Alien Subs](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Alien_Subs)

In OXCE, the TFTD-style articles can also be used in UFO-based mods.

section.description: String ID of the UFOpaedia section this article belongs to.

hiddenCommendation.description: If set on a Commendation article (determined by **section**), the article will remain hidden until the corresponding commendation is awarded to at least one soldier.

requires.description:
List of [topics](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Research) (string IDs) that must be researched to unlock this article. If none are specified, this article is unlocked from the start.

If using lootable weapons ('alien' weapons that can be used without research) needing a research to fully unlock, make sure to define it on both the weapon and ammo. Otherwise the damage reading is visible on the inventory screen using \[ALT\] on a clip.

image_id.description:
Filename of the [background image](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/UP001.SPK-UP042.SPK) displayed on this article, if applicable.

In OXCE:

*   This attribute can be used also for _Vehicle_ articles
*   If the name contains a **"\_CPAL" suffix**, its (custom) palette will be used instead of the default one. Relevant for _Craft, CraftWeapon, TextImage and Vehicle (HWP)_ articles. More info here: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4957.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4957.0.html)

text.description:
String ID of the description displayed on this article.

In OXCE, you can use the {ALT} keyword to switch between primary and secondary color.

align_bottom.description: If set to true, the **text** will be vertically aligned to the bottom.

text_width.description: Maximum width of the text displayed, only applicable to _TextImage_ articles.

rect_stats.description: Rectangle (**x**, **y**, **width**, **height**) of the stats text on the screen, only applicable to _Craft_ articles.

rect_text.description:
Rectangle (**x**, **y**, **width**, **height**) of the description text on the screen, only applicable to _Craft_ articles.

In OXCE, it is also applicable to _TextImage_ articles.

weapon.description: String ID of the weapon, only applicable to _Vehicle_ (HWP/SWS) articles.

pages.description:
Configuration of additional pages for an article.

*   Each page can have its own title and text description.
*   Additionally, you can define which **ammoSlot** will be used to limit the display of supported attack types and compatible ammo.
*   If multiple pages have same value of **ammoSlot**, then each page will show successive group of 3 ammo items available for this slot.

Example:

```
 - id: STR_PISTOL
   pages:
     - title: STR_PISTOL
       text: STR_PISTOL_UFOPEDIA
       ammoSlot: 0                  # default for all pages
     - title: STR_PISTOL
       text: STR_PISTOL_UFOPEDIA_2
       ammoSlot: 1                  # ammo and attack types relevant for the second ammo slot (0 = first slot)
     - title: STR_PISTOL_UFOPEDIA_TITLE_3
       text: STR_PISTOL_UFOPEDIA_3
       

```
pages.default: Only one page using standard title and text.

id.description: String ID of the trajectory name.

groundTimer.description: Amount of seconds for the UFO to spend on Ground waypoints.

waypoints.description:
List of items defining the waypoints and flight segments for the UFO to traverse, defined as _\[zone, altitude, speed\]_.  

**zone**: Regional missionZone index (used to randomly generate the waypoint's coordinates).  
**altitude**: UFO altitude:

*   0 - Ground
*   1 - Very Low
*   2 - Low
*   3 - High
*   4 - Very High

**speed**: UFO speed as a percentage (0-100%) of its maximum speed.

type.description: String ID of the mission type.

points.description: [Score](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Score) allocated to aliens for successfully completing this mission.

waves.description: List of UFO waves to spawn as this mission progresses, as described below.

ufo.description: String ID of the [UFO](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#UFOs) to spawn.

trajectory.description: String ID of the [trajectory](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#UFO_Trajectories) for this UFO to use when entering Earth's atmosphere.

timer.description:
How long after the previous wave should this wave arrive? (in minutes)

Notes:

*   The timer can vary between 50-150% of the stated value, so a UFO with a 9000 value will be spawned between 4500-13500 minutes (each day has 1440 minutes)
*   If the UFO is crashed/destroyed the timer of the next UFO on the wave will be delayed by (30 \* (RNG::generate(0, 400) + 48)) minutes, or between 1.0 and 9.3 days

objective.description: _true_ Marks this wave as the one that carries out the mission objective. Only for mission site / supply missions.

objectiveOnTheLandingSite.description:
Only relevant when using non-point mission zone areas for mission site spawning.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10305.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10305.0.html)

Since OXCE v7.9 also relevant for alien base building: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10860.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10860.0.html)

objectiveOnXcomBase.description:
Overrides the mission site location with an xcom base location.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10810.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10810.0.html)

hunterKillerPercentage.description:
The chance (0-100%) to become a hunter-killer UFO upon spawning.

Possible options:

*   \-1 = take the info from RuleUfo
*   0 = not a hunter-killer
*   1-99 = percentage chance to be flagged as hunter-killer upon spawn
*   100 = always a hunter-killer

huntMode.description:
Algorithm to use when prioritizing xcom targets.

Possible options:

*   \-1 = take the info from RuleUfo
*   0 = prefer hunting xcom interceptors
*   1 = prefer hunting xcom transports
*   2 = random preference (0 or 1) determined at spawn

huntBehavior.description:
Algorithm to use when considering retreating from the dogfight.

Possible options:

*   \-1 = take the info from RuleUfo
*   0 = flee if you're losing
*   1 = never flee, never crash (is destroyed instead of crashing)
*   2 = random preference (0 or 1) determined at spawn

escort.description: Does this wave escort/protect the previous wave(s)?

interruptPercentage.description:
The chance (0-100%) to interrupt the alien mission when successfully shooting down a UFO from this wave; or when winning a ground mission of a landed UFO.

Possible options:

*   0 = cannot interrupt
*   1-99 = percentage chance to be interrupted
*   100 = always interrupted

objective.description:
Missions are split by objective:

*   0 = score (default if omitted)
*   1 = infiltration
*   2 = alien base
*   3 = mission site (terror etc)
*   4 = retaliation
*   5 = supply
*   6 = instant xcom base defense: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10808.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10808.0.html)

showAlienBase.description: Should a new alien base be discovered/shown immediately after it is spawned? (works for **objective** 1 and 2)

spawnZone.description: Regional missionZone to use when spawning mission sites / alien bases.

missionWeights.description: Only works for alien retaliation missions spawned during dogfights. If your mod has multiple possible retaliation missions, the game chooses one randomly, but considering weights defined in this attribute. The weights are defined as a list of (month: weight) pairs. If nothing is specified, weight is 1 (for all months).

retaliationOdds.description: Probability (0-100%) that a UFO shot down while performing this mission will generate a Retaliation mission.

endlessInfiltration.description: Should an infiltration mission end after the first cycle (false) or continue indefinitely (true)?

multiUfoRetaliation.description: Should the retaliation mission end after the first base defense (false) or continue until all already spawned UFOs disappear (true)?

ignoreBaseDefenses.description: Should the attacking retaliation UFO ignore xcom base defenses?

despawnEvenIfTargeted.description: Should a mission site expire/despawn even if it is targeted by an xcom craft or not?

interruptResearch.description: Discovering this research topic interrupts the mission immediately.

siteType.description:
Alien deployment to use when spawning mission sites / alien bases. If not specified, alienDeployment from Geoscape texture is used.

Note: for alien bases there is one more hardcoded fallback (STR\_ALIEN\_BASE\_ASSAULT) if both deployments mentioned above are missing.

raceWeights.description: List of alien races likely to carry out this mission, and the % chance of them being allocated to this mission, listed by "number of months after game beginning".

operationType.description:
From where does this mission operate?

Possible options:

*   0 = from space
*   1 = from an existing alien base in the mission region
*   2 = from a new alien base in the mission region
*   3 = from a new alien base in the mission region if necessary, otherwise from an existing alien base
*   4 = from an existing alien base anywhere on Earth
*   5 = from a new alien base anywhere on Earth if necessary, otherwise from an existing alien base
*   6 = a hunt mission spawned from an existing alien base

More description for this and the following attributes here: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6557.msg104669.html#msg104669](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,6557.msg104669.html#msg104669)

operationSpawnZone.description: The missionZone for spawning the operation base (if necessary), see above.

operationBaseType.description: The type of operation base to spawn (references alien deployment), see above.

targetBaseOdds.description: The odds of this mission targeting an xcom base. Works only for **genMission** spawned by an alien base.

regionWeights.description: The region distribution over game time. Works only for **genMission** spawned by an alien base.

type.description: Name of the script used for overwriting or deleting purposes.

firstMonth.description: Months this command runs on, 0 runs on startup of a new game

lastMonth.description: Do not run after this month. In this context we mean "run once". -1 denotes no limit.

label.description: A numeric label that can be used for conditional execution of commands. Each label should be unique within the command list (0=default no need for uniqueness).

conditionals.description:
Defines the conditions that allows the execution of this command. For example, \[1, -4\] means it will be executed if command with **label** 1 was a success and command with **label 4** failed.

Commands that are not yet executed are always in failed state.

missionWeights.description: The type of mission to spawn (omit to pick one from the alien strategy mission table). These are split into monthly chunks, and can contain multiple entries including weighted odds, but there is a caveat here: You cannot mix and match missions with mission site objectives (i.e. terror sites) with regular missions. They are generated too differently. Using **executionOdds** and **conditionals** instead can achieve exactly the same thing. Similarly, terror missions should not appear in regional mission weights (regions.rul).

targetBaseOdds.description: % chances of this mission targeting a region containing an xcom base... instead of a random region (which CAN also contain an xcom base).

startDelay.description: Number of minutes to delay the start of the mission (rounded down to the nearest 30). For 0 the wave timer from the mission itself is used.

randomDelay.description: Additional randomized delay (in minutes). Total delay = **startDelay** + RNG(0, **randomDelay**)

raceWeights.description: List which can override established monthly race weights if desired.

regionWeights.description:
List which can override established monthly region weights if desired. This will come into play only if the mission doesn't target an xcom base.

If the list is omitted: for a terror type mission, all regions that meet the criteria will be weighed equally. For regular missions the normal regional distribution weights will be applied.

minDifficulty.description: This command only applies to difficulty levels of this or above.

minScore.description: This command only applies if last month's rating was above this threshold. Not checked before first month.

maxScore.description: This command only applies if last month's rating was below this threshold. Not checked before first month.

minFunds.description: This command only applies if the new month's funds are above this threshold. Not checked before first month.

maxFunds.description: This command only applies if the new month's funds are below this threshold. Not checked before first month.

missionVarName.description:
These variables allow accessing internal mission script tracking variables (see **varName**), or internal object counters.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

missionMarkerName.description:
These variables allow accessing internal mission script tracking variables (see **varName**), or internal object counters.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10318.0.html)

counterMin.description: This script command only applies if the corresponding counter (**missionVarName** or **missionMarkerName**) is at least this number.

counterMax.description: This script command only applies if the corresponding counter (**missionVarName** or **missionMarkerName**) is at most this number. -1 denotes no limit

researchTriggers.description:
A list of research topics that can influence the execution of this mission. For example

*   "_STR\_THE\_ULTIMATE\_THREAT: true_" means the mission would only run if the player has researched the Ultimate Threat.
*   "_STR\_TLETH\_TH\_ALIEN\_CITY: false_" means the mission would only run if the player has not researched T'Leth.

Several research triggers can be combined and for the mission to appear all must be fulfilled.

itemTriggers.description: A list of items that can influence the execution of this script. Similar to research triggers; checks the presence of items in the base stores (not anywhere else).

facilityTriggers.description: A list of base facilities that can influence the execution of this script. Similar to research triggers; checks the presence of a facility (in any xcom base).

xcomBaseInRegionTriggers.description: A list of regions that can influence the execution of this script. Similar to research triggers; checks the presence (or absence) of an xcom base in a given region.

xcomBaseInCountryTriggers.description: A list of countries that can influence the execution of this script. Similar to research triggers; checks the presence (or absence) of an xcom base in a given country.

maxRuns.description: This mission type can only execute this number of times, -1 for infinite.

avoidRepeats.description: This is used to ensure different coordinates for this mission. It means "store an array of _x_ previous coordinates, and don't use them again".

varName.description: This is an internal variable name, used for tracking **maxRuns** and **avoidRepeats**.

useTable.description:
Check if this mission type appears in the mission tables. If _true_ remove it from there.

Note: this is used for "classic approach" (before mission scripts existed), where missions were pre-generated at the beginning of the campaign in alien strategy table and removed from there one by one to avoid repetitions.

type.description: Name of the arc script used for overwriting or deleting purposes.

sequentialArcs.description: The names of research topics to be "discovered", each month 0 or 1, processed sequentially.

randomArcs.description: The names and weights of research topics to be "discovered", each month 0 or 1, chosen randomly considering weights.

firstMonth.description: Months this command runs on, 0 runs on startup of a new game.

lastMonth.description: Do not run after this month. -1 denotes no limit.

maxArcs.description: Maximum number of arcs this command can generate (together during the whole game), -1 for infinite.

minDifficulty.description: This command only applies to difficulty levels of this or above.

maxDifficulty.description: This command only applies to difficulty levels of this or below.

minScore.description: This command only applies if last month's rating was above this threshold. Not checked before first month.

maxScore.description: This command only applies if last month's rating was below this threshold. Not checked before first month.

minFunds.description: This command only applies if the new month's funds are above this threshold. Not checked before first month.

maxFunds.description: This command only applies if the new month's funds are below this threshold. Not checked before first month.

counterMax.description: This script command only applies if the corresponding counter (**missionVarName** or **missionMarkerName**) is at most this number. -1 denotes no limit

*   "_STR\_MARTIAL\_SOLUTION: true_" means the command would only run if the player has researched The Martian Solution.
*   "_STR\_CYDONIA\_OR\_BUST: false_" means the command would only run if the player has not researched Cydonia or Bust yet.

Several research triggers can be combined and all must be fulfilled.

facilityTriggers.description: A list of base facilities that can influence the execution of this script. Similar to research triggers; checks the presence of a facility (in any xcom base).

xcomBaseInCountryTriggers.description: A list of countries that can influence the execution of this script. Similar to research triggers; checks the presence (or absence) of an xcom base in a given country.

type.description: Name of the event script used for overwriting or deleting purposes.

oneTimeSequentialEvents.description: The list of one time sequential events to spawn. First not-previously-generated event is spawned.

oneTimeRandomEvents.description: The list of one time events to spawn. One random not-previously-generated event is spawned. Weights are considered.

eventWeights.description: The type of events to spawn. These are split into monthly chunks, and can contain multiple entries including weighted odds.

firstMonth.description: Months this command runs on, 0 runs on startup of a new game.

lastMonth.description: Do not run after this month. -1 denotes no limit.

minDifficulty.description: This command only applies to difficulty levels of this or above.

maxDifficulty.description: This command only applies to difficulty levels of this or below.

minScore.description: This command only applies if last month's rating was above this threshold. Not checked before first month.

maxScore.description: This command only applies if last month's rating was below this threshold. Not checked before first month.

minFunds.description: This command only applies if the new month's funds are above this threshold. Not checked before first month.

maxFunds.description: This command only applies if the new month's funds are below this threshold. Not checked before first month.

soldierTypeTriggers.description: A list of soldier types that can influence the execution of this script. Similar to research triggers; checks the presence of a soldier type (in any xcom base).

affectsGameProgression.description: If set to true, research topics from **researchTriggers** will display a small disclaimer in the TechTreeViewer about affecting game progression.

name.description: String ID of the event name. Use {0} placeholder (in the actual translation) for region/city name.

description.description: String ID of the event description. Use {0} placeholder (in the actual translation) for region/city name.

background.description: String ID of the background image to use in the window when this event pops up on the Geoscape.

music.description: String ID of the music to play when this event pops up on the Geoscape.

regionList.description: List of regions, where this event can occur. The region name can be a part of the event name and/or description.

city.description: Whether or not the event occurs in a random city (of the given region(s)). The city name can be a part of the event name and/or description.

points.description: How many score/rating points are awarded to xcom when this event pops up. If there is a region, points are awarded to that region's activity, otherwise to the research score.

funds.description: How much money is awarded to xcom when this event pops up.

spawnedPersonType.description:
Allows to "hire" soldiers, scientists and engineers.

More info here: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7215.msg132650.html#msg132650](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7215.msg132650.html#msg132650)

spawnedPersonName.description: When "hiring" a soldier, you can (optionally) specify also his/her name. The name is translatable.

spawnedSoldier.description: When "hiring" a soldier, you can (optionally) specify overrides for any of the soldier's attributes. Uses the same syntax as the saved games. Cannot override soldier's ID and name.

everyItemList.description: A list of item IDs. When this event pops up they are all transferred to the HQ (within 1 hour).

everyMultiItemList.description: A list of item IDs and their quantities. When this event pops up they are all transferred to the HQ (within 1 hour).

randomItemList.description: A list of item IDs. When this event pops up one of them is selected randomly and transferred to the HQ (within 1 hour).

randomMultiItemList.description: A list of "lists of item IDs and their quantities". When this event pops up one of the lists is selected randomly and everything in that list is transferred to the HQ (within 1 hour).

weightedItemList.description: A weighted list of item IDs. When this event pops up one of them is selected randomly (respecting given weights) and transferred to the HQ (within 1 hour).

researchList.description: A list of research topic IDs. One (from the not-yet-discovered) is randomly selected when this event pops up and granted for free.

interruptResearch.description: String ID of a research topic that will prevent (an already generated/scheduled) event from popping up.

timer.description: Number of minutes (after generation) after which the event should pop up. Minimum is 60. Should be a multiple of 30.

timerRandom.description: Additional random timer in minutes. Total delay = **timer** + RNG(0, **timerRandom**).

type.description: Name of the original sprite/spritesheet to modify or new sprite/spritesheet to create.

typeSingle.description: Alternative to **type**, used for defining single sprites with less verbose ruleset. Changes the default value for **singleImage** to _true_.

files.description: List of the new sprites to add/replace, listed as _spriteID: filepath_.

fileSingle.description: Alternative to **files**, used for defining single sprites with less verbose ruleset.

width.description: Width of the whole sprite/spritesheet in pixels.

height.description: Height of the whole sprite/spritesheet in pixels.

singleImage.description: Is the image file just a single sprite (true) or a spritesheet (false)?

subX.description: Width of the subdivision in pixels. If a subdivision is specified, then the image file (a spritesheet) is divided into chunks (sprites).

subY.description: Height of the subdivision in pixels. If a subdivision is specified, then the image file (a spritesheet) is divided into chunks (sprites).

type.description:
ID of the original sound file to modify:

*   BATTLE.CAT - Battlescape sounds, corresponds to _SOUND1.CAT_ or _SAMPLE2.CAT_ (55 sounds).
*   INTRO.CAT - Intro sounds, corresponds to _INTRO.CAT_ or _SAMPLE3.CAT_, probably best not to mess with these.
*   GEO.CAT - Geoscape sounds, corresponds to _SOUND2.CAT_ or _SAMPLE.CAT_ (14 sounds).

files.description: List of the new sounds to add/replace, listed as _soundID: filepath_.

type.description: Internal name of the music track.

name.description: Name of the music track. If empty, **type** is used as name.

catPos.description: The track's index in the catalog (CAT) file. Only relevant for music stored in CAT files, obviously.

normalization.description: The track's normalization level. Only relevant for music stored in CAT files.

type.description: Filename of the original language file to modify (without file extension).

strings.description: List of the new strings to add/replace, listed as _stringID: text_.

type.description: Name of the interface. Each OpenXcom screen has a unique corresponding interface.

palette.description: Name of the palette (e.g. PAL\_BASESCAPE) to be used for this screen. Not all screens support this.

parent.description:
Name of the parent interface (from which some attributes are inherited).

For example research/manufacture screens have a hierarchy of screens opening on top of each other.

music.description: Music to play when the corresponding screen is opened.

sound.description: Sound effect (from GEO.CAT) to play when the corresponding screen is opened.

backgroundImage.description: Background image for the corresponding screen.

altBackgroundImage.description: Alternative background image for the corresponding screen (in battlescape theme). Used for UIs that can be displayed both in geoscape and battlescape mode.

elements.description: List of detailed definitions for various elements on the screen (window, text, buttons, lists, etc.). See below.

size.description: Some elements have configurable size. Defined as \[width, height\].

pos.description: Some elements have configurable position. Defined as \[x, y\], where x<320 and y<200.

color.description: Most elements have configurable primary color (0-255). Elements called _palette_ only have range between 0-15 (palette offsets).

color2.description: Some elements have configurable alternative/secondary color (0-255).

border.description: Some elements have configurable border/tertiary color (0-255).

custom.description:
A generic-purpose attribute.

Currently used only for inventory interface, specifies which stats are displayed.

TFTDMode.description: Is used in TFTD for inversion behavior in some elements, mostly buttons.

psiStrength.description:
One or more stat ranges are AND-ed together to find a match.

Each range has a format \[min, max\]. Use YAML standard tilde (~) to indicate empty value (interpreted as 0 for min and as 255 for max).

psiSkill.description:
One or more stat ranges are AND-ed together to find a match.

Each range has a format \[min, max\]. Use YAML standard tilde (~) to indicate empty value (interpreted as 0 for min and as 255 for max).

bravery.description:
One or more stat ranges are AND-ed together to find a match.

Each range has a format \[min, max\]. Use YAML standard tilde (~) to indicate empty value (interpreted as 0 for min and as 255 for max).

strength.description:
One or more stat ranges are AND-ed together to find a match.

Each range has a format \[min, max\]. Use YAML standard tilde (~) to indicate empty value (interpreted as 0 for min and as 255 for max).

Each range has a format \[min, max\]. Use YAML standard tilde (~) to indicate empty value (interpreted as 0 for min and as 255 for max).

Each range has a format \[min, max\]. Use YAML standard tilde (~) to indicate empty value (interpreted as 0 for min and as 255 for max).

tu.description:
One or more stat ranges are AND-ed together to find a match.

Each range has a format \[min, max\]. Use YAML standard tilde (~) to indicate empty value (interpreted as 0 for min and as 255 for max).
