One or more stat ranges are AND-ed together to find a match.

Each range has a format \[min, max\]. Use YAML standard tilde (~) to indicate empty value (interpreted as 0 for min and as 255 for max).

type.description: String ID of the cutscene.

winGame.description:
Whether or not the cutscene ends the game with victory.

More info about multiple game endings: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7476.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7476.0.html)

loseGame.description: Whether or not the cutscene ends the game with defeat.

useUfoAudioSequence.description: Whether to use the audio sequence for the original UFO intro movie. This should only ever be set to true for the UFO intro.

videos.description: A list of video filenames to play with the FLC player. Required if this cutscene is a video playlist.

audioTracks.description: A list of audio filenames to play along the videos specified in **videos**. Optional.

slideshow.description: Info for playing a slideshow (see below). Required if this cutscene is a slideshow.

transitionSeconds.description: Override for **transitionSeconds** from Slideshow Data, so that each slide can have a different value.

musicId.description: The ID of the music to play.

slides.description: List of slide data elements (see below).

imagePath.description:
The path to the image file to display in the background.

**Note**: the palette for the slide is taken directly from the image, so the caption text color will be determined by the image palette.

caption.description: The string ID of the caption text.

captionSize.description: The size of the text box, in pixels, in which to display the caption.

captionPos.description: The screen position at which to display the caption.

captionColor.description: The palette index to use for the caption color.

captionAlign.description: The horizontal text alignment for the caption text. Possible values: 0 = left, 1 = center, 2 = right.

captionVerticalAlign.description: The vertical text alignment for the caption text. Possible values: 0 = top, 1 = middle, 2 = bottom.

fontName.description: Name of \*.dat file, placed in Language folder, which describes used [font collection](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Font_collection_(OpenXcom)).

disableUnderwaterSounds.description:
Redirects the game to BATTLE.CAT whenever it would want to access BATTLE2.CAT, i.e. underwater sounds will be the same as surface sounds.

Hint: a debug option for people working on hybrid UFO/TFTD mods to (for the time being) prevent crashes on missing sounds.

enableUnitResponseSounds.description:
Enables/disables unit response sounds.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7371.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7371.0.html)

unitResponseSoundsFrequency.description: Sets the probabilities of unit response sounds being played (each time). First number is for "select unit" sound, second for "start moving" sound, third for "select weapon" sound and fourth for the "annoyed" sound.

unitResponseSounds.description:
Custom unit response sounds per individual soldier name... when soldier type/armor/gender is just not RPG enough :) Hardcore.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7371.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7371.0.html)

Syntax:

```
 unitResponseSounds:
   - name: Starving Poet
     selectUnitSound:   [200, 201, 202, 203, 204]
     startMovingSound:  [210, 211, 212, 213]
     selectWeaponSound: [220, 221, 222, 223]
     annoyedSound:      [230, 231, 232, 233]
   - name: Ivan Dogovich
     selectUnitSound:   [300, 301, 302, 303, 304, 305]
     startMovingSound:  [310, 311, 312, 313]
     selectWeaponSound: [320, 321, 322, 323]
     annoyedSound:      [330, 331, 332, 333, 334, 335]

```

baseNamesFirst.description:
Data for the random base name generator. **baseNamesMiddle** and **baseNamesLast** are optional. Example:```
 baseNamesFirst:
   - Big
   - Huge
   - Large
   - Stinky
 baseNamesMiddle:
   - Rat
   - Pirate
 baseNamesLast:
   - Bay
   - Port
   - Haven
   - Tavern

```

baseNamesMiddle.description:
Data for the random base name generator. **baseNamesMiddle** and **baseNamesLast** are optional. Example:```
 baseNamesFirst:
   - Big
   - Huge
   - Large
   - Stinky
 baseNamesMiddle:
   - Rat
   - Pirate
 baseNamesLast:
   - Bay
   - Port
   - Haven
   - Tavern

```

baseNamesLast.description:
Data for the random base name generator. **baseNamesMiddle** and **baseNamesLast** are optional. Example:```
 baseNamesFirst:
   - Big
   - Huge
   - Large
   - Stinky
 baseNamesMiddle:
   - Rat
   - Pirate
 baseNamesLast:
   - Bay
   - Port
   - Haven
   - Tavern

```

operationNamesFirst.description:
Data for the random operation name generator. **operationNamesLast** is optional. Example:```
 operationNamesFirst:
   - Blind
   - Burning
   - Cold
   - Dark
   - Devil's
   - Enduring
   - Fallen
 operationNamesLast:
   - Blade
   - Dream
   - Future
   - Justice
   - Rain
   - Star
   - Thunder

```

operationNamesLast.description:
Data for the random operation name generator. **operationNamesLast** is optional. Example:```
 operationNamesFirst:
   - Blind
   - Burning
   - Cold
   - Dark
   - Devil's
   - Enduring
   - Fallen
 operationNamesLast:
   - Blade
   - Dream
   - Future
   - Justice
   - Rain
   - Star
   - Thunder

```

startingTime.description: Specifies the date and time at the beginning of the game.

initialFunding.description: Amount of money (in thousands of dollars) the player starts with.

monthlyRatings.description:
A list of monthly ratings. Each item contains a minimum required score and a corresponding String ID of the rating. Example:```
 monthlyRatings:
   5000: STR_MT_RATING_AMAZING
   2000: STR_MT_RATING_PERFECT
   1000: STR_MT_RATING_VERY_GOOD
   500: STR_MT_RATING_GOOD
   250: STR_MT_RATING_OK
   0: STR_MT_RATING_MEH
   -350: STR_MT_RATING_BAD
   -99999: STR_MT_RATING_TERRIBLE

```

performanceBonusFactor.description: Defines whether the player receives a financial bonus based on the monthly score. If set for example to 1000 and monthly score is 650, the player receives an extra $650000. In case of a negative monthly score, there is no penalty.

customTrainingFactor.description: Additional RNG for stat improvement using martial/combat training facilities. Can be used to slow down training (cannot speed it up). If set for example to 20, the training speed will be five times slower than normal (i.e. training at 20% speed).

psiUnlockResearch.description: In OpenXcom, this is set to Psi-Lab requirements (i.e. the building with **psiLabs** > 0). In OXCE, you can set a different research topic to allow Psi screening (using the _Psi-Strength Evaluation_ advanced option) before the actual Psi training (in Psi Labs) is possible.

fakeUnderwaterBaseUnlockResearch.description: Research topic required to be able to build bases on "fake underwater" globe textures.

newBaseUnlockResearch.description: Research topic required to be able to build new bases on any globe texture.

allowAlienBasesOnWrongTextures.description: If a valid location cannot be found after 100 random attempts, use an invalid location (land texture vs. fake underwater texture).

allowCountriesToCancelAlienPact.description: If enabled, XCOM can convince countries that left the XCOM project to come back... by destroying the alien base that was created when the aliens signed a pact with a given country.

buildInfiltrationBaseCloseToTheCountry.description: If enabled, alien infiltration bases will be built in or near the infiltrated country (as opposed to anywhere in the whole region).

chanceToStopRetaliation.description: If an XCOM base is found and a battleship sent to attack it is shot down by base defense facilities, aliens will keep sending new battleships potentially for a long time. This setting defines a chance that they reconsider their decision (after each failed attack) and stop sending more battleships.

lessAliensDuringBaseDefense.description: If enabled, less aliens will spawn in base defense missions, roughly proportional to damage dealt to the invading UFO. At least one alien of each rank is guaranteed to spawn.

gameOver.description:
A list of cutscene names for special events. More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7476.msg117830.html#msg117830](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7476.msg117830.html#msg117830)```
 gameOver:
   loseMoney: loseGame       # cutscene ID that should be played when the player loses due to poor economy management
   loseRating: loseGame      # cutscene ID that should be played when the player loses due to poor rating
   loseDefeat: loseGame      # cutscene ID that should be played when the player loses the last base

```

timePersonnel.description: Time (in hours) it takes for newly hired personnel to arrive at a base.

hireByCountryOdds hireByRegionOdds.description:
Used to define the odds of attempting to name the soldier based on the country/region where it was hired.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10845.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10845.0.html)

costEngineer.description: Monthly salary of a single engineer (in dollars). Please note that hiring cost is twice as much.

costHireEngineer.description: Cost of hiring a single engineer. If not specified (0), it costs twice as much as the monthly salary.

hireEngineersUnlockResearch.description: Research topic required to be able to hire engineers.

hireEngineersRequiresBaseFunc.description: A list of base services required to be able to hire engineers.

costScientist.description: Monthly salary of a single scientist (in dollars). Please note that hiring cost is twice as much.

costHireScientist.description: Cost of hiring a single scientist. If not specified (0), it costs twice as much as the monthly salary.

hireScientistsUnlockResearch.description: Research topic required to be able to hire scientists.

hireScientistsRequiresBaseFunc.description: A list of services required to be able to hire scientists.

soldiersPerSergeant.description: How many soldiers (of any rank) are required to unlock a new sergeant promotion.

soldiersPerCaptain.description: How many soldiers (of any rank) are required to unlock a new captain promotion.

soldiersPerColonel.description: How many soldiers (of any rank) are required to unlock a new colonel promotion.

soldiersPerCommander.description: How many soldiers (of any rank) are required to unlock the commander promotion. There can be only one commander at a time.

shortRadarRange.description: The maximum radar range still considered as short (for \[Base Info\] screen purposes). If not specified (0), the smallest range from all radar facilities is used.

buildTimeReductionScaling.description: When upgrading base facilities, reduce the build time reduction by this factor (in percent). Or in simpler words, increase the upgrade time.

enableNewResearchSorting.description: If enabled, the player will be able to sort the list of available research topics by name and cost.

displayCustomCategories.description:
Should custom item categories be used in Buy/Sell/Transfer screens?

*   0 = no, only vanilla categories
*   1 = yes, only custom categories
*   2 = yes, both vanilla and custom categories

shareAmmoCategories.description: If enabled, firearms will "inherit" the categories of their ammo (only the available ammo counts). Affected are: 1/ Craft Equipment screen and 2/ Starting conditions (allowed/disabled item categories). Not affected: Buy/Sell/Transfer screens.

maxLookVariant.description: The maximum supported lookVariant (0-63) used in \[Change Soldier Avatar\] dialog.

flagByKills.description:
OXCE allows to display flags next to soldier names, based on their nationality (resp. based on the name pool from which their name was chosen). If this setting is used, the flag will depend on the number of kills from soldier's diary instead.```
 flagByKills: [10,20,30]

```

Example above means:

*   0-10 kills = Flag0 sprite is used
*   11-20 = Flag1 sprite
*   21-30 = Flag2 sprite
*   31+ = Flag3 sprite

alienInventoryOffsetX.description: Hand slots of the "alien inventory" (inventory accessible via Middle-button-click) will be shifted to the right by this much.

alienInventoryOffsetBigUnit.description: Hand slots of the "alien inventory" (inventory accessible via Middle-button-click) will be shifted away from each other by this much for 2x2 units.

selectBaseSound.description:
Sound ID from [GEO.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when a base is selected on the globe. Can be a list with multiple options.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10195.msg143054.html#msg143054](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,10195.msg143054.html#msg143054)

startDogfightSound.description: Sound ID from [GEO.CAT](https://www.ufopaedia.org/index.php/Ruleset_Reference_Nightly_(OpenXcom)#Extra_Sounds) played when a dogfight starts. Can be a list with multiple options.

drawEnemyRadarCircles.description:
When should the alien UFO (hunter-killer) and alien base radar ranges be drawn? Possible options:

*   0 = never drawn
*   1 = drawn for bases if discovered and for UFOs if hyper-detected
*   2 = drawn for bases if discovered and for UFOs if detected

pilotAccuracyZeroPoint.description: Average firing accuracy for a pilot (where the accuracy bonus is 0%).

pilotAccuracyRange.description: The firing accuracy impact (as a percentage of the distance to the zero point) on the pilot's aim in dogfights.

pilotReactionsZeroPoint.description: Average reactions for a pilot (where the dodge bonus is 0%).

pilotReactionsRange.description: The reactions impact (as a percentage of the distance to the zero point) on the pilot's dodge ability in dogfights.

pilotBraveryThresholds.description: The pilot's bravery needed for \[Very Bold, Bold, Normal\] approach speed during dogfights. If neither is reached, approach speed is Cowardly.

showDogfightDistanceInKm.description: Should the distance between the craft and a UFO be shown in kilometers (true) or in vanilla units (false)? Vanilla units equal to 8-times the distance in kilometers.

ufoGlancingHitThreshold.description: The threshold for defining a glancing hit on a UFO during interception. Defined as a percentage of damage needed to shoot it down (i.e. half of **damageMax**).

ufoBeamWidthParameter.description: The parameter for drawing the width of a UFO's beam weapon based on power. The width of the beam in pixels will be weapon power divided by this parameter, but at least 3 pixels. For example if the weapon power is 250 and parameter is 50, the beam size in pixels will be 5.

ufoTractorBeamSizeModifiers.description:
The modifiers to a tractor beam's power based on a UFO's size.```
 ufoTractorBeamSizeModifiers:
   - 400 # very small, tractor beams are 400% or 4x as effective
   - 200
   - 100
   - 50
   - 25 # very large, tractor beams are 25% or 1/4x as effective

```

hunterKillerFastRetarget.description: If enabled, the UFO hunter-killers can reconsider their target every 5 seconds on low game speeds (5sec/1min) and every 10 minutes on all other game speeds. If disabled, it is only every 10 minutes on all game speeds.

escortRange.description: Range (in nautical miles) in which the craft is considered to be escorted by a nearby craft.

escortsJoinFightAgainstHK.description: Should craft escorts join the fight against HK automatically (true)? Or is only fighting one-on-one allowed (false)?

crewEmergencyEvacuationSurvivalChance.description: The chance of soldiers (that are not pilots) surviving craft destruction by a UFO hunter-killer (jumping out with a parachute).

pilotsEmergencyEvacuationSurvivalChance.description: The chance of pilots surviving craft destruction by a UFO hunter-killer (emergency seat ejection).

pediaReplaceCraftFuelWithRangeType.description:
What type of information should be shown in craft articles for the fuel capacity/range? Possible options:

*   \-1 = Fuel capacity
*   0 = Maximum theoretical range
*   1 = Minimum and maximum theoretical max range
*   2 = Average theoretical max range

hidePediaInfoButton.description: Show the INFO button (where applicable) or not?

extraNerdyPediaInfoType.description:
Display extra item info (accuracy modifier and power bonus) in the main pedia article or not?

*   0 = don't display
*   1 = display with full names
*   2 = display with abbreviations

alienFuel.description: Name of an item representing alien fuel and a quantity to recover from a single fuel cell. Format: \[name, quantity\].

baseDefenseMapFromLocation.description:
Whether or not to load additional base defense terrain from globe texture. 0 = no, 1 = yes.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,5108.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,5108.0.html)

lighting.description:
Configuration of light propagation:

*   **enhanced**: flags to switch between vanilla and directional light propagation (1 = directional for tiles and fire, 2 = directional for items, 4 = directional for units); add the numbers together to turn on multiple flags (e.g. 1+2+4=7 = directional lighting for all light sources)
*   **maxStatic**: maximum range/radius for tile and fire light propagation
*   **maxDynamic**: maximum range/radius for item and unit light propagation

Defaults:

```
 lighting:
   enhanced: 0
   maxStatic: 16   #Careful, affects overall game performance!
   maxDynamic: 24  #Careful, affects overall game performance!

```

maxViewDistance.description:
Maximum view distance (in tiles). If you want to use bigger/custom view distances (in general, or per armor), you need to set this variable to the maximum of all view distances you're using.

**VERY IMPORTANT**: Although optimized (in OXCE) a lot compared to OpenXcom, this setting still has huge impact on game performance! The performance decrease is exponential, i.e. changing value from 20 to 40 doesn't decrease the performance only by a factor of 2, but much much more. Recommended maximum value is up to 30. If you're willing to sacrifice game performance you can go up to 40. Above 40, it's unplayable.

maxDarknessToSeeUnits.description:
The threshold of shade/darkness for LoS calculation. Shade ranges (for value set to 9):

*   0 = no shade: Daylight, full visibility.
*   1-9 = partial shade: Dusk/Dawn, also full visibility.
*   10-15 = full shade: Night, decreased visibility for XCOM.

noLOSAccuracyPenaltyGlobal.description: A global default value for accuracy penalty (in percent), when shooting at a unit or tile outside of LoS (line of sight). Can be overridden per weapon.

kneelBonusGlobal.description: A global default value for accuracy bonus, when kneeling. Can be overridden per weapon. 115 means 15% bonus (100+15).

oneHandedPenaltyGlobal.description: A global default value for accuracy penalty, when using a two-handed weapon with just one hand. Can be overridden per weapon. 80 means 20% penalty (100-20).

enableCloseQuartersCombat.description: Whether or not CQC (close quarters combat) feature should be enabled. 0 = no, 1 = yes.

closeQuartersAccuracyGlobal.description:
A global default "accuracy" value for CQC check. Can be overridden per weapon.

**FIXME**: add a full example of CQC check, with all variables included.

closeQuartersTuCostGlobal.description: Amount of time units the target unit (victim) needs to have to be able to perform CQC. If CQC is triggered, TUs will be also spent. If CQC is not triggered, TUs will **not** be spent.

closeQuartersEnergyCostGlobal.description: Amount of energy the target unit (victim) needs to have to be able to perform CQC. If CQC is triggered, energy will be also spent. If CQC is not triggered, energy will **not** be spent.

closeQuartersSneakUpGlobal.description:
Percentage chance of avoiding CQC when sneaking up on an enemy.

Alien attacker can avoid CQC when xcom victim doesn't see the alien attacker. Xcom attacker can avoid CQC when all aliens (as a collective) were not aware of the xcom attacker during the previous and the current turn.

tooMuchSmokeThreshold.description:
A technical parameter, which you may want to change if you want to be able to (always) extinguish fire from map tiles using smoke.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4057.msg59352.html#msg59352](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4057.msg59352.html#msg59352)

hiddenMovementBackgrounds.description: A list of sprites for "Hidden Movement" backgrounds. Chosen randomly at the beginning of a mission. Purely cosmetic.

showFullNameInAlienInventory.description: A global default value for showing unit name (true) or unit race (false) in the \[Alien Inventory\] screen. Can be overridden per unit type.

destroyedFacility.description: A global default value defining a special "rubble" facility that remains after a normal facility is destroyed (during base defense or via alien missile attacks/bombardment). Must have size 1. Can be overridden per facility type.

giveScoreAlsoForResearchedArtifacts.description: Whether the game awards score (in Debriefing) also for researched alien artifacts (true) or only for not yet researched artifacts (false).

missionRatings.description:
A list of mission ratings. Each item contains a minimum required mission score and a corresponding String ID of the rating. Example:```
 missionRatings:
   2000: STR_MS_RATING_HOLY_COW
   1000: STR_MS_RATING_AMAZING
   750: STR_MS_RATING_PERFECT
   500: STR_MS_RATING_VERY_GOOD
   350: STR_MS_RATING_GOOD
   150: STR_MS_RATING_OK
   0: STR_MS_RATING_MEH
   -200: STR_MS_RATING_BAD
   -350: STR_MS_RATING_WORSE
   -500: STR_MS_RATING_TERRIBLE
   -1000: STR_MS_RATING_DISASTER
   -99999: STR_MS_RATING_EPIC_FAIL

```

statisticalBulletConservation.description: If enabled, there's a chance to recover a full clip depending on how much ammo has remained.

stunningImprovesMorale.description:
If enabled, stunning enemies improves morale in a similar way killing an enemy does.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7439.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7439.0.html)

tuRecoveryWakeUpNewTurn.description: Percentage of max TU that should be given to a unit that wakes up from unconsciousness at a beginning of a new turn.

mana.description:
Global switches to turn mana GUI and features on/off.

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7241.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,7241.0.html)

Example:

```
 mana:
   enabled: false
   battleUI: false
   unlockResearch: STR_SORCERY     # empty by default
   trainingPrimary: false
   trainingSecondary: false
   woundThreshold: 200             # default is 200
   replenishAfterMission: true

```

health.description:
Health recovery modding options. Allows soldiers to go into battle even with missing health.

More info: FIXME

Example:

```
 health:
   woundThreshold: 100             # default is 100
   replenishAfterMission: true

```

minReactionAccuracy.description: Minimum firing accuracy for reaction fire. Used to prevent AI making shots that are unlikely to hit, which only makes them waste ammo and TUs. Instead they could wait until the target comes closer or shoot at another target.

turnAIUseGrenade.description: Defines a turn, from which the aliens are allowed to use grenades.

turnAIUseBlaster.description:
OXC: Defines a turn, from which the aliens are allowed to use any AoE weapons (blaster launcher, small launcher, etc.).

OXCE: Defines a turn, from which the aliens are allowed to use waypoint-based weapons.

ai.useDelayFirearm.description: Defines a turn, from which the aliens are allowed to use firearms.

ai.useDelayMelee.description: Defines a turn, from which the aliens are allowed to use melee weapons.

ai.useDelayPsionic.description:
Defines a turn, from which the aliens are allowed to use psi amps.

Example:

```
 ai:
   useDelayBlaster: 3
   useDelayFirearm: 1
   useDelayGrenade: 1
   useDelayMelee: 1
   useDelayPsionic: 2

```

surrenderMode.description:
Allows enemies to surrender (they will be taken as prisoners). Possible options:

*   0 = no surrender
*   1 = if all remaining standing enemies can surrender; and they want to surrender at this very moment (their current status is panicking or berserking)... end the battle
*   2 = if all remaining standing enemies can surrender; and they have panicked/berserked at least once or have been stunned at least once... end the battle
*   3 = same as option 2, but enemies must also have empty hands

In all 3 cases, enemies marked as "auto surrender" are not checked and count as surrendered.

bughuntMinTurn.description: Earliest turn on which the "bughunt mode" can be activated. Once activated, it won't be turned off (except on multi-stage missions). During bughunt mode, you can see all remaining enemies on the minimap.

bughuntMaxEnemies.description: Maximum amount of active enemies for bughunt mode to trigger.

bughuntRank.description:
If VIPs are still active, bughunt won't trigger. Possible options:

*   \-1 = no VIPs
*   0 = aliens with rank 0 are VIPs
*   1 = aliens with rank 0 and 1 are VIPs
*   2 = aliens with rank 0, 1 and 2 are VIPs
*   and so on...

bughuntTimeUnitsLeft.description:
Defines a threshold for "too much TUs".

If a unit doesn't have any weapon (in both hands) or if a unit has "low morale" or if a unit has "too much TUs" (i.e. cannot/doesn't move for whatever reason)... it counts as powerless and bug hunt can be activated.

If there is still a unit that is not powerless, bug hunt won't be activated.

startingDifficulty.description:
Pre-selected difficulty when starting a new game. Possible options:

*   0 = beginner
*   1 = experienced
*   2 = veteran
*   3 = genius
*   4 = superhuman

difficultyDemigod.description:
If enabled, enemies will spawn even if the map doesn't have enough spawn points to spawn them all.

Note: affects all difficulty levels, not just Superhuman difficulty.

difficultyCoefficient.description:
Difficulty coefficients (per 5 game difficulty levels) affecting various game mechanics, for example:

*   Monthly rating threshold for losing the game (together with **defeatScore**) | (defeatScore) +100 points \* difficultyCoefficient
*   UFO firing rate during dogfight | -2 gs \* difficultyCoefficient
*   UFO escape countdown during dogfight | (100-200%) -30 gs \* difficultyCoefficient
*   Retaliation odds after shooting down UFO | (4%) +4% \* difficultyCoefficient
*   Odds of shootdown-triggered retaliation targeting xcom base region or not | (50%) +6% \* difficultyCoefficient
*   Chance of aliens facing in the direction of the xcom craft at a start of a mission | 20% \* difficultyCoefficient
*   Various AI decisions (in Battlescape)
    *   judging explosive efficacy
    *   limiting number of waypoints for blasters
    *   deciding whether to spend extra TU to attack from behind in melee (OXCE only)
    *   odds of making USE action on psi-amps (OXCE only)
*   Together with **statGrowthMultipliers** affects how alien stats change with difficulty level | + (statGrowthMultipliers/100) \* difficultyCoefficient
*   Does not affect aimAndArmorMultipliers, aimMultipliers and armorMultipliers.

difficultyCoefficientOverrides.description:
Ability to override **difficultyCoefficient** effects:

*   Monthly rating threshold for losing the game | directly specified value per difficulty
*   UFO firing rate during dogfight | percentual multiplier per difficulty
*   UFO escape countdown during dogfight | percentual multiplier per difficulty
*   Retaliation odds after shooting down UFO | directly specified percentage value per difficulty
*   Odds of shootdown-triggered retaliation targeting xcom base region or not | directly specified percentage value per difficulty
*   Chance of aliens facing in the direction of the xcom craft at a start of a mission | directly specified percentage value per difficulty

Example (with some vanilla values):

```
difficultyCoefficientOverrides:
  monthlyRatingThresholds: [-900, -800, -700, -600, -500]   # vanilla points; please note that only NEGATIVE numbers are accepted here
  ufoFiringRateCoefficients: [100, 95, 90, 85, 80]          # percent of default... percentages instead of vanilla flat values
  ufoEscapeCountdownCoefficients: [100, 95, 90, 85, 80]     # percent of default... percentages instead of vanilla flat values
  retaliationTriggerOdds: [4, 8, 12, 16, 20]                # vanilla percentages
  retaliationBaseRegionOdds: [50, 56, 62, 68, 74]           # vanilla percentages
  aliensFacingCraftOdds: [0, 20, 40, 60, 80]                # vanilla percentages

```

difficultyBasedRetaliationDelay.description:
Defines a delay (in months, per difficulty level) for spawning retaliation missions after dogfights. If the campaign is still in the "protected period", retaliation missions won't spawn. This can be used to prevent unlucky base defense missions in early game for beginners.

Note: does not affect regularly spawned retaliation missions (via monthly mission script), nor alien base gen/hunt missions.

aimAndArmorMultipliers.description: Affects armor values and firing accuracy of aliens for different difficulty levels.

aimMultipliers.description: Affects firing accuracy of aliens for different difficulty levels.

armorMultipliers.description: Affects armor values of aliens for different difficulty levels.

statGrowthMultipliers.description: Affects unit stats of aliens for different difficulty levels.

defeatScore.description: Monthly score threshold for losing the game on Beginner difficulty. Other difficulties have different thresholds, affected by **difficultyCoefficient**.

defeatFunds.description: Debt threshold (at a start of a month) for losing the game, on all difficulty levels.

sellPriceCoefficient.description:
Affects global sell prices. Defined in percent per difficulty level. Example:```
 sellPriceCoefficient: [150, 100, 80, 60, 40]

```

damageRange.description: Defines the damage range for projectile weapons. 100 means 0-200% range, 50 means 50-150% range, 25 means 75-125% range, etc.

explosiveDamageRange.description: Defines the damage range for AOE weapons (e.g. explosives).

fireDamageRange.description: Defines the damage range for incendiary weapons. Format is: \[min, max\].

explosionOffset.description:
Explosion offset in X1.PCK

Note: this defines the land explosion offset. Underwater explosion offset is smaller by 8. For example, if you define land offset to be 24, underwater offset will be automatically set to 16.

smokeOffset.description: Surface smoke animation offset in SMOKE.PCK

underwaterSmokeOffset.description: Underwater smoke animation offset in SMOKE.PCK

extendedItemReloadCost.description: If set to true, the item reload cost equals to "cost of moving ammo to hand" + "cost of reload".

extendedRunningCost.description: If set to true, running soldiers will ignore mutual surprise (i.e. will not stop running when spotting a new enemy).

extendedHwpLoadOrder.description:
If set to true, craft load order is: 2x2 HWPs, 2x2 soldiers, 1x1 HWPs, 1x1 soldiers.

If false, load order is: all HWPs, all soldiers.

extendedMeleeReactions.description:
Enables reactions to melee attacks.

*   0 = vanilla, cannot react to melee attacks
*   1 = can react to melee attacks, if attacked from the front
*   2 = can react to melee attacks, if attacked from any side

extendedTerrainMelee.description:
Allows melee weapons to destroy terrain.

*   0 = vanilla, turned off
*   1 to 11 = turned on (higher number means that it only applies to taller objects/walls)

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8634.0.html](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8634.0.html)

extendedUnderwaterThrowFactor.description:
Allows globally changing underwater throwing range.

*   0 = vanilla, turned off
*   1+ = turned on, e.g. 60 means underwater throwing range equals to 60% of the surface throwing range

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8273.msg132698.html#msg132698](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,8273.msg132698.html#msg132698)

extendedExperienceAwardSystem.description:
Allows to switch between OXC and OXCE experience award system.

*   false = use OXC system
*   true = use OXCE system

More info: [https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4230.msg154823.html#msg154823](https://openxcom.org/forum/index.php/topic,4230.msg154823.html#msg154823)

itemDrop.description: Sound of item dropping (in the inventory).

buttonPress.description: Sound played when a button is pressed.

windowPopup.description: Sounds played (one chosen randomly) when a window pops up.

ufoHit.description: Sound of a UFO being hit.

ufoExplode.description: Sound of a UFO being destroyed.

interceptorHit.description: Sound of an XCOM interceptor being hit.

interceptorExplode.description: Sound of an XCOM interceptor being destroyed.

geoscapeCursor.description: Palette offset for a cursor when using PAL\_GEOSCAPE palette.

basescapeCursor.description: Palette offset for a cursor when using PAL\_BASESCAPE palette.

battlescapeCursor.description: Palette offset for a cursor when using PAL\_BATTLESCAPE\* palettes.

ufopaediaCursor.description: Palette offset for a cursor when using PAL\_UFOPAEDIA palette.

graphsCursor.description: Palette offset for a cursor when using PAL\_GRAPHS palette.

goodDebriefingMusic.description: Music played in the Debriefing when the score is positive.

badDebriefingMusic.description: Music played in the Debriefing when the score is zero or negative.
